Top-Quality Supplies at Manufacturer-Direct Prices

One Supplies is a trusted B2B wholesaler providing top-quality warehouse, paper, and restaurant supplies. We offer manufacturer-direct pricing, ensuring you get the best value on essential products. Count on us for reliable service and competitive rates to meet all your business needs.

START YOUR CIRCULAR JOURNEY WITH US


Our Services & Specialties
	
Circularity Integration
	
Assessing the circularity of businesses using our 5R framework of refuse, reduce, reuse, remanufacture, and recycle.
Defining immediate and long-term goals to improve the sustainability and environmental performance of businesses.
Providing expert guidance in materials science, environmental impact, and operations management for effective implementation.
Identifying and evaluating waste-to-resource opportunities through techno-economic and environmental impact analyses.
	
	
R&D Lab Services
	
Providing laboratory support in formulation development and characterization of bio-based materials.
Offering green chemistry consulting for sustainable process development and eco-friendly innovations.
Conducting proof-of-concept experimental studies for waste-to-resource chemical processes.
Performing biodegradability and compostability testing in accordance with ASTM and ISO standards.
	
	
Life Cycle Assessment
	
Performing life cycle assessments (LCA) in compliance with ISO standards to evaluate the environmental impacts of products, processes, and services.
Quantifying enviromental impacts beyond greenhouse gas emissions metrics to avoid impact shifting.
Providing data-driven insights to support decision making for sustainability improvement.
Offering guidance in using LCA results for effective and transparent environmental marketing campaigns.
	
LEARN MORE ABOUT OUR R&D LAB SERVICES
	
Curious about how the circular economy can drive your business growth?
We offer businesses a two-hour overview of circular economy principles and practices at no cost.
REACH OUT TO US TO SCHEDULE YOUR SESSION
	
LEARN MORE ABOUT OUR LIFE CYCLE ASSESSMENT (LCA) SERVICE
	
90% Reduction
To combat climate change and to ramp up the actions needed for a sustainable future, the Paris Agreement sets the ultimate goal of limiting the average global temperature rise to 1.5 °C in this century. In pursuit of this goal, greenhouse gas emissions must be reduced, at least, to below 5 billion tons CO2 equivalent by about 2050. The current efforts in place are far less than what is needed to meet this target.
	

REFUSE . REDUCE . REUSE . REMANUFACTURE . RECYCLE .

Our 5R Strategy for Increased Circularity
	
Circular Economy
To achieve significant reductions in emissions, we must transition from the traditional take-make-dispose economic model to a circular economy that rethinks materials, designs, and operations to retain as much value as possible from products, parts, and resources. In this circular economy, extending product lifespan, reducing the waste at the design stage, recovering and reintroducing products into the supply chain, and expanding our reliance on sustainable materials are key principles that inform the 5R strategy in our circular economy consulting services.
	
LEARN MORE ABOUT OUR CIRCULARITY INTEGRATION SERVICES

At Aduro Clean Technologies we are in the business of between. Between what is difficult and what is possible. Between what is waste and what is valuable.

Between is where everything we do happens. It's where our technology platform thrives.

Our technologies have the potential to make more plastics recyclable, heavy oils more environmentally sustainable, and renewable fuels more cost-effective. And we are just getting started.

Our technology platform means we don’t have to choose between the benefits of modern life and an environmentally sustainable future.

ABOUT US

Aesus Packaging Systems was founded in 2003 and was the amalgamation of D. L. Tech Inc (founded in 1995) and EDT (founded in 1997).

The founding partners of Aesus were previously partners or employees at Kalish (founded in 1956).

More About Us

We are Growing
Some of our latest videos. Take a look at what is new.

LIQUID PACKAGING SOLUTION

Watch an impressive liquid packaging line with a Bottle Unscrambler that is fully integrated to a Liquid Filler, a Starwheel Capper, an Inline Wrap Around Pressure Sensitive Labeler, a Tamper Evident and Full Body Shrink Labeler and a Patented HYBRID Heat Shrink Tunnel. Making for a perfect fully automatic liquid packaging line.

Learn More

POUCH LABELER

Pouch labeling solution that can apply labels onto the top and or bottom of your empty pouches.   This solution comes complete with a dual stack feeding magazine and an accumulation conveyor.

Learn More

DELTA STARPRISM LABELER

Labeling at higher speeds! Products are conveyed into a starwheel whereby two rollers stabilize the containers while the label is applied. The product therefore is securely held at 3 separate stabilizing points.  Check out this unique and patented Aesus labeling system – Delta Star Prism Labeler.
Learn More

BOTTLE UNSCRAMBLER

The machine uses the tried and proven hook and belt system that can handle containers from 1 inch diameter through 4 inch diameter and up to 10 inches in height. It is ideal for pharmaceutical, cosmetic, and other plastic containers up to 200 bottles per minute – AESSort Unscrambler.

Learn More

TapScan enables brands to create dynamic, customizable programs tailored to specific locations, times and shopper languages. Choose or combine any of the following TapScan capabilities:

Gated Omni-Channel Shopping

Location-Based Customization

Alberta Beverage Container Recycling Corporation

Alberta Beverage Container Recycling Corporation (ABCRC) oversees the collection and recycling of more than 150,000 different types of regulated, non-refillable beverage containers sold in Alberta. Used beverage containers are transported from more than 220 independently-owned depots located throughout Alberta, then sorted and processed at ABCRC facilities.

ABCRC strives to continuously improve the return rates on all beverage containers while promoting the environmental, economic and social benefits of recycling. 

Learn More About Us
Sustainability

As an environmental stewardship organization, ABCRC is dedicated to operating using corporate social responsibility best practices. By regulation, ABCRC also reports annually to Alberta’s government.

Learn More
Recycling Facts

Recycled materials can do amazing things! Did you know that a thousand milk jugs can be used to make a new recycled park bench? Or that the energy saved from recycling just one glass bottle can run a 100-watt light bulb for four hours?

Learn More
Careers with ABCRC

ABCRC is looking for dedicated people who want to join a hard-working team, make a difference and enjoy a healthy work/life balance. We’re growing, and are always on the lookout for passionate people to join our amazing team

Packaging is one the most important indicators of a good quality product.

We ensure your packaging supply speaks volumes.
UNPACK OUR WORK
A craft enhanced by enthusiasm to tell your story.

With decades of experience and passion in what we do, combined with knowledgeable experts in our fields, we deliver the best results in packaging innovation, supply and management.

ARRANTI is a leader in the flexible packaging industry. We specialize in creating unique and sustainable products. And, have done so for over 30 years. If you wish to elevate your packaging game, we are the guys to turn to. We understand how packaging plays a crucial role in protecting and presenting brands. Yet, it does not have to come at the cost of the environment. That’s why we have made it our mission to develop eco-friendly solutions that reduce waste. And, without sacrificing quality or functionality.

Our team of specialists leverages cutting-edge technology and advanced materials for better outcomes. Our goal is to meet the highest standards of durability, safety and sustainability. Whether you need packaging for food, cosmetics or pharmaceuticals, we provide custom options. We are forever exploring new and effective techniques to stay ahead of the curve.

With ARRANTI, you can trust you are working with a company that values quality, creativity and integrity above all else.

 

 

Arranti is proud to be part of PAC Global, aligning with leaders in packaging innovation and sustainability. Through this membership, we gain valuable insights, collaborate with industry experts, and contribute to initiatives that advance sustainable practices, helping shape a greener future for packaging worldwide.

A PROUD PAC GLOBAL MEMBER

Capturing someone’s attention is a pivotal moment. It can spark curiosity and engagement or prompt an instant dismissal. That’s why every color, every detail in your design matters. We ensure they stay true to form, helping you make the impression you deserve.

TRUE-TO-COLOR CONSISTENCY

Customers notice every detail—the color, your logo, the font you choose. Every decision shapes how your story is told, and we make sure it’s conveyed with style. Whatever you envision, we bring to life—without exception.

TRUE-TO-STYLE DIGITAL PRINT

We did not set out to change what’s already been created. We took a different approach; a step to the side, to implement a design that is both unique and functional. Create a premium consumer experience. And, make your statement.

TRUE-TO-FORM PREMIUM PRINTING TECHNIQUES

EXPLORE OUR PROCESS
True to color. True to style. True to form. ARRANTI remains True to expectations. (view video below)
Creating innovative packaging…again and again.

You’ve created something special, and we’ve created a packaging supply that is truly unique. When put together, your consumer gains the best you have to offer, not once but twice. Nominated for the 2020 PAC Award for Package Design Innovation, our “patented” Stand-Up Dual Chamber Pouch technology runs on existing filling lines with minor modifications. A single SKU separates into two consumer-friendly stand-up pouches.

EXPLORE OUR PRODUCTS

Dealing with Jeff & the group at Arranti has always been a pleasure. Ryan Herniman, Brand Builder

Jeff and his team at Arranti have been very professional and easy to work with through multiple packaging projects. Mark Dimitrof

I want to make a big shout-out to Jeff Herrington and Team Arranti! The company's Commitment to Quality, Customer Service and making you feel like you are in the best hands you can be! BTW... the best damn protein pouches, period. They look great and are extremely durable.

John Morin, Inner Armour

From ink-stained hands, to leading production demands.

Trends come and go, technology evolves, but craft and passion are forever. From the confines of his Dad’s garage, Jeff Herrington first learned the art and craft of printing techniques by hand.
With ink-stained fingers, he transformed his father’s legacy into a market leader for printed packaging and design.

That passion is the foundation of Arranti’s success. While most companies react to trends, Arranti sets them. And, ensures that expertise and passion combine to create something truly remarkable for your products. From advanced printing techniques to pioneering packaging innovations, Arranti delivers superior results to create a custom packaging experience that tells your products’ story.

Total Package Solutions

At Atlantic, we strive to understand the customer’s packaging requirements. We aim to tailor every experience best suited for each individual client. Our services go beyond delivering boxes: we deliver on customer satisfaction by meeting requirements through customized solutions.

We provide end-to-end packaging solutions to our clients. From corrugated packaging to recyclable paper bag products and retail displays, we understand the market like no other. We oversee all stages of product development from ideation to deployment. We take charge right from recycling material for manufacturing to finding the best logistics and supply management solutions for your business.

We provide more than just packaging – we deliver an experience.

About Us

Atlantic Packaging is a company with rich history, culture, and an indomitable spirit to do good. For the past 75 years, Atlantic Packaging has worked towards preserving the environment and ensuring not a single tree is cut to manufacture boxes. We are proud to state that we save close to 14 million trees every year and continue to work towards achieving a greener planet!

30 Years’ Experience Manufacturing Biaxially & Mono Oriented Film

EVLON® Compostable Film, research and development trials for pre-commercialization purposes and production of APTRA breathable film are our core business.

News
What We Do...
EVLON® Compostable Film... Are you ready to go green?

Environmentally friendly, compostable clear film and sheet material, EVLON®, is made from NatureWorks PLA Ingeo resin or Total Corbion resin.

Made from plants, EVLON®, fills the worldwide desire to utilize renewable resources and provides an environmentally friendly, crystal clear, strong product that can be used in a variety of packaging applications such as sealed produce bags, confectionary bags, bakery bags and sealed over-wrap.

The film can be plain or printed and laminated, for horizontal and vertical packaging machines.

EVLON® products can be industrially composted, and the material will breakdown and revert to carbon dioxide and water in less than 90 days.

Food contact certification in USA, EU and Canada.

R&D
Research & Development Pre-Production Trial Runs

We offer a product development facility for customers to develop biaxially and mono direction oriented products. Products can move from the lab environment and into a pre-production phase for assessment and modifications to achieve the desired physical properties. 

Capabilities are a biaxial orientation line and a mono direction line, capable of laminating additional layers on to sheet as well as extruding and orienting sheet and film in large quantities. 

 

The facility has been used by several of the world's largest petrochemical, packaging and food companies.

Aptra®
APTRA® Breathable Film

BI-AX manufactures Aptra® Classic and Aptra® UV films.

Aptra® is a breathable film used as a composite with other materials. Though it barely registers on the scales, this unique film provides an exceptional combination of barrier properties and breathability.

Aptra® is easily laminated with a wide variety of substrates using several methods. Composite structures utilizing spunbond nonwovens are one of the many configurations possible. Lamination can be accomplished by point bonding with heated calenders, sonic bonding, heat sealing and spray adhesives.

A wide variety of applications: roofing underlayment, housing wrap, disposable protective garments, medical apparel and industrial garments.

Making evlon compostable film since 2001...doing our part for the environment
History
30+ Years Manufacturing Biaxially and Mono Oriented Film

BI-AX International Inc. was founded by brothers David and Tom Inglis in 1986 and production of biaxially oriented polypropylene (BOPP) began in 1987. Initial markets were pressure sensitive tape and food packaging.

In 2000, the operation expanded with a 220,000 square foot plant in Wingham, Ontario, Canada.
Since then niche markets in product development trials, compostable film ( EVLON® ) and breathable, microporous products (Aptra® ) have dominated our business.

Another capability is mono-directional orientation of heavy sheet with the ability to add extra layers. This can be done with sheet that has been made in other locations with various layer configurations.

Recently we added the availability of GMO-free PLA resin for our EVLON line of products.

Much of our time is used in toll manufacturing for other companies that require production of their specialty products. This is a more economical way for them to enter a growing market than the purchase of expensive equipment.

Your Environmental Alternative

This site is designed to give residents in our membership area from the many municipalities located in Huron, Perth, Lambton, and Middlesex Counties in Southwestern Ontario the most up-to-date information to maximize waste diversion. Check out our material guide under the recycling tab which explains how to dispose of over 225 different items! Get your local information by navigating to your community under the schedule tab.

When our collection services are affected this page will reflect any impact on you.  Alternatively, if you download our free Recycle Coach app, you will receive notices right to your phone.

HOME COMPOSTABLE BIOPLASTICS OUR TECHNOLOGY ABOUT BOSK CONTACT NEWS BLOG 
 UPSTREAM SOLUTION TO THE
GLOBAL PLASTIC WASTE ISSUE  
 COMPOSTABLE BIOPLASTICS MADE FROM RENEWABLE RESOURCES,
COMPATIBLE WITH THE PLASTIC PROCESSING VALUE CHAIN. 
TO GET MORE INFORMATION ABOUT PRODUCTS MADE WITH OUR BIOPLASTICS VISIT MADE-WITH-REGEN.CA 
VISIT MADE-WITH-REGEN.CA
BOSK BIOPRODUCTS
BOSK Bioproducts  offers a solution to the global problem of plastic waste accumulation. 

Plastics are widely used and are traditionally derived from petrochemicals. BOSK produces a plastic-like material, with similar properties, but it is made from renewable ressources. BOSK's bioplastics, sold under the brand REGEN™, are biobased, compostable, and compatible with standard plastic product manufacturing equipment.

BOSK's bioplastics are a great solution for companies that want to increase the value of their products while minimizing their environmental impact.

The key to REGEN™ resides in Bosk's innovative technology to produce PHA (Polyhydroxyalcanoates), from industrial untapped carbon sources such as Pulp & Paper sludges.

Moreover, REGEN™ is a solution to fight against climate change. Each tonne of bioplastic could avoids up to 3 tonnes of GHG emissions. 

BOSK offers a sustainable alternative to plastics.
LEARN MORE ABOUT BOSK
WE DEVELOP, MANUFACTURE AND DISTRIBUTE
​BIOBASED AND COMPOSTABLE PHA-BASED COMPOUNDS. 
​
Convenient
	
Efficient
	
Sustainable
	
Value Added
DISCOVER OUR PRODUCTS
COMPOSTING, A TRULY SUSTAINABLE SOLUTION
Even recycled plastics have a limited useful life and will eventualy end-up in landfills, be incinerated, or enter the environement. Composting is the only solution to transform products back into basic natural elements that usefull and beneficial for the environment. Fully compostable bioplastics offers a viable and responsible end-of-life alternative for products and enables a zero waste solutions. 
READ MORE INFO IN OUR BLOG
OUR TECHNOLOGY
 Bosk’s tehcnology constitues a radical innovation. It offers a fully compostable bioplastic at a competitive cost. Unlike most other PHAs on the market, our proprietary PHA does not contain or use any GMOs, is non-toxic and is made from forest industry renewable, untapped carbon sources. 
ABOUT OUR TECHNOLOGY
BEST-IN-CLASS PARTNERS
Our partners chose to take part in this renewable value chain because they believe we all can make a difference.
	
	
SUBSCRIBE TO OUR MAILING LIST TO BE THE FIRSTS
​TO KNOW OUR LATEST NEWS
SUBSCRIBE
A CANADIAN COMPANY
	
ABOUT BOSK BIOPRODUCTS
​BOSK is a Canadian company specializing in compostable bioplastics. BOSK's bioplastics, sold under the brand REGEN™, are biobased, compostable, and compatible with standard plastic product manufacturing equipment. BOSK's bioplastics are a great solution for companies that want to increase the value of their products while minimizing their environmental impact. 
The key to REGEN™ resides in Bosk's innovative technology to produce PHA (Polyhydroxyalcanoates), from industrial untapped carbon sources such as Pulp & Paper sludges.
Moreover, REGEN™ is a solution to fight against climate change. Each tonne of bioplastic could avoids up to 3 tonnes of GHG emissions. BOSK offers a sustainable alternative to plastics.
	
TAKE PART IN THE NEW PLASTIC ECONOMY GREENER, NOT LESS PERFORMANT
​
CHOOSE REGEN™

We Change the Materials and Processes of Global Industries for a Better World

From paper to plastic, ink to textile products, to packaging, BW Converting changes things for the better. ​

We design and manufacture precision machinery for Tissue, Hygiene, Print, Packaging, Mailing, Textiles and other high-performance Industrial applications. ​

We unify our product brands Paper Converting Machine Company (PCMC), Winkler+Dünnebier (W+D), Baldwin Technology Co., Hudson-Sharp, STAX Technologies, and Northern Engraving and Machine under one global organization as part of the $3.6 billion Barry-Wehmiller Corporation to help maximize global industry potential today and tomorrow.

START HERE TOUR OUR UNIVERSITY
Our Founding Your Future

Since 1901, Cal Poly and Learn by Doing have been inextricably linked. Combining rigorous academics and real-world applications, Learn by Doing has guided and inspired hundreds of thousands of our students toward successful careers for well over a century — and can do the same for you well into your future. 

EXPLORE LEARN BY DOING

California Impact

Learn by Doing ensures you play an active role in helping solve some of California’s — and the world’s — most complex challenges: climate change, tech and humanity, space, the built environment, food and wine, and entrepreneurship, to name just a few. It also helps to ensure that when you graduate, both you and employers will agree with us that you are ready.

Learn by Doing Leads the way

Cal Poly’s six academic colleges offer more than 150 undergraduate majors and minors, as well as over 50 graduate programs. Learn by Doing unifies our colleges and animates the curriculum of each — because no matter the field of study, the best way to build new knowledge is to try it out for yourself.

Our Mission

Protecting California’s environment and climate for the health and prosperity of future generations through the reduction, reuse and recycling of California resources, environmental education, disaster recovery and the transition from a disposable to a fully circular economy.

CalRecycle is implementing new recycling programs while building a Zero Waste Plan for how to transition to a fully circular economy.

Working together for a Canada without plastic waste or pollution.

12345

The Canada Plastics Pact is made up of a diverse mix of leading organizations and governments from across Canada’s plastics value chain who are committed to eliminating plastic waste and pollution, while advancing a circular economy for plastics. By fostering innovation, collaboration and collective action, we are developing, testing and scaling solutions to the systemic barriers that will keep the right plastics in the economy and all plastics out of people, animals and nature.

CLEAR ACTIONABLE TARGETS

Define a list of plastic packaging that is to be designated as problematic or unnecessary and take measures to eliminate them

100%
plastic packaging designed to be reusable, recyclable or compostable

50%
of plastic packaging is effectively recycled or composted

30%
recycled content across all plastic packaging

The Canada Plastics Pact is a member of the Ellen MacArthur Foundation’s Plastics Pact network, a globally aligned response to plastic waste and pollution, that enables vital knowledge sharing and coordinated action. The Foundation, through its New Plastics Economy initiative, has united more than 1,000 organizations behind a common vision for a circular economy for plastic.

 

Together, we are tackling plastic pollution with plastic solutions.

Jun 2018
Ocean Plastics Charter

The Charter brings together leading governments, businesses and civil society organizations to support its objectives and commit to taking action to move toward a more resource efficient and sustainable approach to the management of plastics.

Feb 2019
Circular Economy Leadership Canada releases ‘A Vision for a Circular Economy for Plastics in Canada’

This report provides five recommendations for Canadians to evolve the plastics economy from one that is linear and wasteful to one that offers economic growth without waste.

Read the report.

Sep 2019
CCME Canada-Wide Strategy on Zero Plastic Waste Phase One

The Canadian Council of Ministers of the Environment (CCME) approved in principle the Canada-wide Strategy on Zero Plastic Waste, which aims to reduce plastic waste, support improved reuse and value recovery to reducing the amount of plastic released in our environment.

Nov 2019
Canada Plastics Pact development and recruitment

More than 40 businesses and organisations across the plastics packaging value chain united to tackle plastic waste and pollution in Canada.

Sep 2020
CCME Canada-Wide Strategy on Zero Plastic Waste Phase Two

The Canadian Council of Ministers of the Environment (CCME) approved in principle the Canada-wide Strategy on Zero Plastic Waste (the Strategy), to reduce plastic waste and pollution and recover the value of plastics through reuse, repair, remanufacture, refurbishment and recycling.

Jan 2021
Launch of the Canada Plastics Pact

Canada Plastics Pact is a unique multi-stakeholder, industry-led, cross-value chain collaboration platform which aims to tackle plastic packaging waste and pollution by bringing together businesses, government, non-governmental organizations and other key actors in the local plastics value chain who are united, working together on achieving clear, actionable targets by the year 2025.

Oct 2021
Launch of CPP Roadmap to 2025

The Canada Plastics Pact Roadmap is a shared action plan that will result in real progress to reduce plastic waste in Canada. Built through unprecedented collaboration between companies, organizations, and governments across the entire plastics value chain, this Roadmap presents a shared vision for a circular economy for plastics packaging and a collaborative action plan to drive tangible change by 2025.

Dec 2021
Government of Canada proposed Single Use Plastics Ban

Government proposes the development of a comprehensive plan to address plastic pollution in the long term that includes a ban on certain harmful single-use plastics in the short term.

Jan 2022
Launch of CPP’s Compostables Rapid Action Group

The objective of this group is to deliver guidelines on compostables packaging in Canada.

Mar 2022
UN Resolution to develop a Treaty on Plastic Pollution

The United Nations creates the world’s first ever global plastic pollution treaty that will have ripple effects on businesses and economies around the world.

Mar 2022
Launch of CPP’s Source Reduction Rapid Action Group

The objective of this group is to publish guidance to support the elimination of unnecessary and problematic plastics in Canada.

Apr 2022
CPP Launches the Canadian guidance for the Golden Design Rules for Plastics Packaging

The Golden Design Rules for Plastic Packaging provides guidance and global standards for Canadian companies to adjust their packaging design and contribute to a circular economy for plastics packaging.

Jun 2022
CPP launch of first pilot standup pouch with 20% PCR* content

In the CPP Recycled Content Working Group, Nova Chemicals and EFS-plastics Inc. developed a mono-material PE pouch with 20% recycled content for plant food applications.

Jul 2022
Release of CPP 2020 baseline data

The Baseline Report marks an important starting point for the CPP and its efforts to transition to a more circular economy for plastics packaging in Canada, with an emphasis on collaboration to drive the systems change required.

Aug 2022
Canada Joins the Global High Ambition Coalition to End Plastic Pollution

The High Ambition Coalition to End Plastic Pollution is committed to develop an ambitious international legally binding instrument based on a comprehensive and circular approach that ensures urgent action and effective interventions along the full lifecycle of plastics.

Nov 2022
UN Global Plastics Treaty Negotiations Begin in Uruguay

The first session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee to develop an international legally binding instrument on plastic pollution, including in the marine environment (INC-1), took place at Punta del Este Convention and Exhibition Centre, Uruguay.

Nov 2022
CPP Hosts First In-Person Partners Summit

More than 100 individuals representing more than 50 organizations from across the plastics value chain gathered in Toronto for a day of knowledge sharing and collaboration to continue to work towards building a circular economy for plastics packaging in Canada.

Dec 2022
Canadian Government’s Single-Use Plastics Ban Takes Effect

Canada prohibits the import and manufacture of single-use plastic checkout bags, cutlery, foodservice ware made from problematic plastics, stir sticks, and straws.

Mar 2023
Launch Of 2021 Annual Report

CPP publishes an aggregated overview of the reporting data from CPP Partners during its launch year.

Apr 2023
Release of Study On Reuse & Refill Of Plastic Packaging In Canada

This national ecosystem scan evaluates and highlights the opportunities to implement reuse and refill systems as a way to reduce the amount of single-use plastic waste and move towards a more circular economy for plastic packaging.

Apr 2023
Release of B.C. IC&I Waste Flows Study

This baseline research aims to better understand the quantity and composition of packaging and paper products (PPP) disposal and diversion (including various types of plastic packaging) from the industrial, commercial, and institutional sectors.

May 2023
CPP Joins Circularity Leaders to Launch PRFLEX

The Canada Plastics Pact (CPP), the Chemistry Industry Association of Canada (CIAC), Circular Materials, the Circular Plastics Taskforce (CPT), Éco Entreprises Québec (ÉEQ), Recycle BC, and The Film and Flexibles Recycling Coalition of the The Recycling Partnership joined forces to launch PRFLEX, an initiative aimed at improving the recovery and recycling rates of flexible plastics collected from Canadian households.

Sep 2023
Launch of Flexibles Roadmap & Guidance to Improve the Recyclability of Flexible Plastic Packaging & Films In Canada

Built through collaboration between companies, organizations, and governments across the entire plastics value chain, this 5- Year Flexibles Roadmap presents a shared vision for a circular economy for flexible plastic packaging and a collaborative action plan to drive tangible change between now and 2027.

Nov 2023
CPP Hosts 2023 Partners Summit

A wide range of stakeholders, including resin producers, manufacturers, retailers, government representatives, recyclers, NGOs, and others, gathered with a shared vision of advancing a circular plastics economy in Canada.

Nov 2023
The Federal Court overturns single-use plastic ban

The court found that the classification of plastics in the cabinet order was too broad to be listed as toxic under the Canadian Environmental Protection Act. The Government of Canada has acted to appeal the overturning of the ban.

Nov 2023
Release Of Discussion Paper To Improve Data Collection, Reporting & Transparency Within The Plastics Packaging Value Chain

This paper explores the challenges the Canadian consumer packaged goods industry faces with plastics data gaps as it strives to achieve reductions in overall packaging waste – plastics and other single-use materials – alongside carbon emission reduction goals.

Dec 2023
Launch of 2022 Annual Report

CPP publishes an aggregated overview of the reporting data from CPP Partners during its second year.

Jan 2024
Release of PCR Integration Guide

The CPP’s Recycled Content Working Group released a guidance document on Integrating PCR in Plastic Packaging to support CPP Partners and other key stakeholders in achieving their recycled content targets and goals.

Apr 2024
CPP attends Plastic Action Zone Side Sessions at INC-4

The fourth session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee to develop an international legally binding instrument on plastic pollution, including in the marine environment (INC-4), took place from 23 to 29 April 2024 at the Shaw Center in Ottawa, Canada.

Apr 2024
Release Of Guidance Document to Support the Elimination of Unnecessary & Problematic Plastics

This document includes a list of unnecessary or problematic items and flagged four in transition as industry collaborates to scale solutions.

Apr 2024
Announced Recipients of Reuse Accelerator Projects

The CPP’s Reuse Accelerator Pods, an initiative partially funded by Environment and Climate Change Canada, will support the scaling of two proven reuse/refill applications and address knowledge and infrastructure gaps that are hindering scaling returnable or refillable packaging systems in Canada.

May 2024
Release of PCR Certification Principles

Read a comprehensive framework for evaluating certification programs for post-consumer recycled content in plastics in Canada.

The Canada Plastics Pact is a member of the Ellen MacArthur Foundation’s Global Plastics Pact network and is a solution space of Generate Canada in partnership with the Smart Prosperity Institute, whose shared vision is a strong and inclusive economy that thrives within nature’s limits.

The Voice of Canada’s Corrugated and Containerboard Industry

The Canadian Corrugated and Containerboard Association (CCCA) is the national voice of the corrugated industry. CCCA members include containerboard mills, corrugator plants, and related organizations from coast to coast who turn to CCCA for value-add support, resources, and education. CCCA is committed to supporting and advancing the industry and showcasing the reliable, recyclable, and innovative benefits of corrugated packaging to all Canadians.

ABOUT THE CCCA
The Humble Box

Canadians are known for their friendly demeanours and the Humble Box is no exception.
However, the Humble box has a proud and exciting story to tell.

HOLIDAY BOX OPENING

BACKBONE OF DIGITAL ECONOMY

CARDBOARD BOX FAMILY TREE

INNOVATION

CHECK OUT OUR YOUTUBE CHANNEL
What is Corrugated Cardboard?

Strong, food-safe and 100% recyclable, corrugated cardboard is a multi-layered packaging material made from two outer layers of thick liner boards and a middle layer of thin, fluted paper creating impact-resistant air pockets.

An ideal choice for industrial packaging, food packaging, retail displays, ecommerce, and much more.

WHAT ARE THE BENEFITS OF CORRUGATED?
Packaging Design: Protects & Engages

Corrugated packaging provides more than just protection and ease for transporting, it provides a customizable and impactful way for you to inform and engage your customers. From business and medical supplies to food, clothing, and everything in between, packaging with corrugated materials allows you to customize your design and support your brand.

EXPLORE THE POWER AND CHOICES OF PACKAGING DESIGN

Thank you for attending the 2024 Canadian Stewardship Conference!

We look forward to welcoming you to the 2026 Conference at the Chateau Frontenac in Quebec City, September 15-16, 2026.

PRESENTS
The Canadian EPR Forum:
September 24 - 25, 2024
Fairmont Royal York
Toronto, ON

Promoting dialogue and understanding across the EPR chain.

EPR

Extended producer responsibility (EPR) is an environmental policy approach in which a producer’s responsibility, physical and/or financial, for a product is extended to the post-consumer stage of a product’s life cycle.

The Event

The 2024 Canadian EPR Forum brings together industry leaders, government policymakers, business operators and innovators from across Canada, the United States and Europe to share
perspectives, knowledge and experience as we prepare for the next phase of EPR, and all the challenges and opportunities it will bring.

The Venue

The Canadian Stewardship Conference will take place at the Fairmont Royal York in downtown Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Conveniently located across from Union Station, this landmark hotel is within walking distance of Toronto’s iconic landmarks and close to the city’s best dining, nightlife and shopping.

Restaurants near the Hotel and everything that Toronto has to offer when you are here!

Innovation

We embrace creativity and forward-thinking solutions to drive progress and meet challenges head-on. Our commitment to innovation fuels our ability to adapt, evolve, and create value for our customers and stakeholders.​

Integrity

We uphold the highest standards of honesty, transparency, and ethical behavior in everything we do. Our integrity is the foundation of trust with our clients, partners, and team members, fostering strong and enduring relationships built on respect and accountability.​

Passion

We are deeply passionate about our work, driven by a relentless pursuit of excellence and a genuine enthusiasm for making a positive impact. Our passion fuels our determination, creativity, and resilience, inspiring us to exceed expectations and achieve meaningful results.​

Trust

We value and prioritize trust in all our interactions, recognizing that it is earned through consistent integrity, transparency, and reliability. We cultivate trust by honoring commitments, communicating openly, and fostering a culture of mutual respect and collaboration within our team and with our stakeholders.​

Our Brands
Partnerships
Contact Us
Centura Brands Inc. specializes in turnkey Marketing and Sales services for global brands, integrating: manufacturing, licensing and sales in Canada since 1989.

We have devoted our passion and our expertise in brand building—exclusively consumer packaged goods (CPG). What makes us unique is our hybrid model; both as brand owners and distributors. Catering to the diverse needs of the retail market and our clients with agility, expertise and devotion as key pillars in our mission to service an industry in the constant evolution.

A Customized Approach

Centura offers a wide range of turnkey services to their partners including:

Innovation, Product Development, Manufacturing
Dedicated Sales and Marketing Department
Full service or customized : Logistics, Manufacturing, and Accounting capabilities
In-house Graphic Design Team
Unlocking Your Brands Potential

We manage the diverse and complex commercial needs of CPG companies desiring to market their brands in Canada for long-term profit and sustainability. Our combined expertise in Marketing, Sales and Distribution has positioned Centura as a key Canadian partner representing leading global organizations in hair, skin, bath & body for over 32 years. 

Centura’s long time success is in customizing strategic brand plans built on strong supplier and retailer relationships. Creating solid, long term goals and partnerships for principals at major retailers across Canada including: Shoppers Drug Mart, Wal-Mart, Costco,  Loblaw Companies Inc., Metro Inc., Sobeys,  London Drugs, McKesson, Rexall, Jean Coutu, Brunet, Uniprix, Familiprix, and Giant Tiger.  Learn More

Our Brands

We have built a diverse portfolio of innovative product lines which include: Dippity-do (dippity-do gels, GIRLS with curls, dippity do Men), La Coupe (La Coupe orgnx), Funcare (licensed children’s personal care) and Little Critters. Our value proposition, quality, efficacy, and iconic brands are being rediscovered and loved by new generations of men and women globally. 

Licensee

Centura is ranked Canada’s leading licensee of children’s personal care products due to long standing partnerships with the world’s leading licensed properties.  “Making bathtime, funtime” is the motto that propels our creativity. Our manufacturing capabilities and in-house graphics team bring these ideas to life.  

Distribution Brands: dippity do , Colab and Johnny Chop Shop (Haircare)

About Us

WHO WE ARE

We create the knowledge, networks, and opportunities that accelerate circular innovation across Canada’s economy.

Our mission

We are moving the concept of circular economy into action by:

Leading by example, putting the principles of circular economy to work in our own actions

Encouraging others to become agents of transformative change, using their full range of influence to accelerate economy-wide action

Convening leaders from business and civil society to collaborate in seeking innovative solutions and strengthening the ecosystem.

Advocating for the circular economy in government, business, and civil society, and engaging all stakeholders from across Canada to move toward greater circularity

Advancing the circular economy

Circular Materials and Health Products Stewardship Association Collaborate to Advance Innovation and Recycling Efforts

Circular Materials and the Health Products Stewardship Association (HPSA) are excited to announce a strategic collaboration focused on advancing common goals and sharing best practices for recycling education and material management in Ontario and New Brunswick to enhance public awareness and support recycling.

LEARN MORE

Circular Materials collaborates with Nespresso to launch its Green Bag Recycling Pilot in London, Ontario 

Circular Materials is pleased to collaborate with Nespresso on its Green Bag Recycling Program in London, Ontario. This marks another milestone in the journey to provide residents with an easy and convenient solution to recycling. The City of London is the first municipality in Ontario to adopt this innovative recycling solution.

LEARN MORE

New Brunswick Marks One Year Since Transition to Extended Producer Responsibility

November 1, 2024, marked an important milestone — the one-year anniversary of the transition to extended producer responsibility (EPR) for packaging and paper products in New Brunswick, the first Atlantic province to implement this framework.

LEARN MORE

First-of-its-kind Material Access Program will return recycled material back to producers

Circular Materials is developing a first-of-its-kind Material Access Program, which will return recycled material directly back to producers for use in new products and packaging. This advanced and scalable solution will create a closed loop supply chain, enabling our producer members to meet recycled content targets and goals across the country.

We create efficient and effective recycling systems

We are a national not-for-profit producer responsibility organization that represents the evolution to a more circular economy where materials are collected, recycled and returned to producers for use as recycled content in new products and packaging.

ABOUT US
Extended producer responsibility

Extended producer responsibility, or EPR, is a policy approach in which producers – the businesses that supply packaging and paper – are responsible for the end-of-life management of their materials.

MORE ON EPR
Our service offerings

Our full-service offerings support producers to meet extended producer responsibility regulation requirements, including collection, management, promotion and education, and reporting.

Technology to power zero-waste packaging at college campuses, hospitals & more.

Our vision is a world without waste.



We help institutions achieve their sustainability goals & reduce operational costs

Solutions for college & university campuses, hospitals, offices & more.

Tap to Reuse Software

Simply borrow with just a credit card, student card or employee card. Integrates with common payment and credential systems so you can eliminate barriers to reuse such as deposits, downloading apps, and exchanging tokens.

Smart Return Solutions

Real-time traceability, robust security and no contamination. Cutting edge IoT technology and timeless aesthetic for convenient returns.

Student ID Integrations

Integrations with leading campus credential providers including Transact, Atrium and more. Our technology also follows industry standard Single Sign-On (SSO) protocol so your students and employees can get started stress-free.

RFID & QR Tracking

RFID & QR are reliable and cost-effective methods of tracking that many of our clients use everyday. We are the only system that enables both for metal and plastic containers at checkout and return.

Grocery Packaging Reuse Program
CIRCULR

how it works


We work with grocery stores and producers in the Toronto and Waterloo / Wellington regions to create a reuse platform that helps reduce our communities collective environmental impact

STEP 1

enjoy products you already love

brand list
STEP 2

return packaging to a local grocer

drop locations
STEP 3

return with our app for a reward

get the app

$100 Billion worth of packaging that could have been reused or recycled is thrown away every year.

Circulr is helping Consumer Packaged Goods brands recapture and reuse packaging to reduce waste.

Consumers simply return rinsed packaging from the brands we work with to a Circulr bin, and track their return through the Circulr  app to receive a deposit or reward (minimum $0.10 for each accepted jar. Once the packaging is dropped off, Circulr collects it, washes it, and ships it back to the brand to be refilled and put back on store shelves.

Recycling solutions for agricultural communities...
Manitoba Stewardship Program Plan Renewal & Expansion
Manitoba Approves Cleanfarms’ Stewardship Program Plan

In July 2023, Manitoba Environment and Climate Change approved Cleanfarms’ Crop Input Packaging Recovery Program. This ensures that Manitoba farmers can continue their long-standing efforts to keep pesticide & fertilizer containers, drums & totes off of farms and incorporated into new products.

Seed, pesticide and inoculant bag collections are now available on a permanent basis which provides new opportunities to keep Manitoba’s farmland and communities clean.

View: approved SSP | approval letter

Shape your public affairs ecosystem. 
Build long-term reputation & resilience. 

Advocacy   |   Stakeholder Engagement   |   Public Policy   |   Communications   |   Social Impact   |   Sustainability

Approach

In today’s world, an organization’s ability to grow and innovate is shaped by an increasingly complex public affairs landscape that’s become more decentralized, more democratized, and more influential.

Organizations must be strategic and proactive about shaping their operating environment to ensure they’re successful and resilient for the long term.

We specialize in helping clients shift from reactive issues management to building proactive public affairs strategies that create the conditions to reduce regulatory risk, drive growth and innovation, and build authentic stakeholder relationships.

We do it by taking a multi-dimensional approach that brings together advocacy, public policy, stakeholder engagement, internal and external communications, sustainability, and social impact.

Services

Our approach is tailored to the specific needs and challenges of our clients. We do this by focusing on three key areas:

Strategy

Building clear and actionable strategies that shape the client’s public affairs ecosystem and build long-term resilience.

Execution

With the right strategy in place, we become an extension of your team and manage the day-to-day effort. Where specialized experts are needed or local insight required, we identify, engage, and support the right partners.

Expert Counsel

We are a sounding board and strategic advisor across a range of issues to help senior leaders problem solve and manage both short and long-term challenges.

Team

We are public affairs strategists who’ve created successful, multi-dimensional strategies for some of the world’s largest organizations, multi-lateral organizations and government.

Click to accept marketing cookies and enable this content

We are a leading designer and manufacturer of fully automatic open mouth container filling lines and machines.  Our machines are mainly used for food packing / packaging in cups, tubs, trays, and buckets.  Our filling machines can be used with many different products like feta, ricotta, cottage cheeses, hot soups, prepared salads, dips, sauces, dried fruits and nuts, powder, salsa, dairy products, ice cream, frozen crumble goat cheese, sauerkraut, kimchi, etc…

Our flexible design with unique preset tooling allows the operator to do a complete container changeover in less than 20 minutes. Typically, with thick products, we can fill up to 60 one pound cups per minute on a single-lane machine.

GET A QUOTE
ANY SIZE, SHAPE, AND MATERIAL OF OPEN MOUTH CONTAINERS
Our cup filling machines can manage almost any size, shape and material of container tubs such as round, square, rectangular or oval cups, tubs, trays and buckets, either in paperboard, aluminium or plastic. We can fill and close tamper evident containers and clamshell type ones. We can also fill, seal and cap sealable ones.
Our automatic cup sealing machines are adapted to work with either plastic film roll or precut foil or plastic lids. Our no vacuum MAP version is fast and efficient. Typically less than 1% of residual oxygen. With the appropriate container and film our seal is good enough for high pressure process (HPP). We can also supply a table top version for small production run.

Thank you for your interest in Corporate Image. Unfortunately, we need to inform you of an important business decision. After four decades of creativity and manufacturing excellence, we regret to announce that our Corporate Image division will cease operations, effective October 31, 2023.




Since 1983, Corporate Image has had the privilege of collaborating with incredible clients on a wide range of projects and we want to express our deepest appreciation for your trust in Corporate Image.




From here on, our team will focus on the continued growth of our other divisions, LBS and Archival Products. LBS is one of the world's leading suppliers of cover materials, cover boards, adhesives, endsheets, reinforcing materials, and headbands to the bookbinding and luxury packaging industries. Archival Products designs and manufactures archivally sound enclosure solutions for the preservation and conservation communities.




If you have any questions or need further information, please don't hesitate to contact our dedicated customer service team at 800.247.8194 or email us at info@corp-image.com.




We wish you continued success and prosperity in all your endeavors.




Sincerely,




Your Corporate Image Team

Crown Packaging: Delivering Value and Experience

Crown Packaging is an integrated manufacturer and marketer of corrugated cartons and sheets, printed paper wraps and wallboard tape.

Crown Packaging has built their strong and loyal customer base by developing and nurturing strategic partnership style relationships. Establishing a thorough understanding of their client’s marketing, operational and distribution needs and strategies, then tailoring packaging solutions with outstanding graphic and structural design characteristics to meet those goals is the benefit both Crown Packaging and their customers realize.

 
CEO's Message

Welcome to Crown Packaging. We are the premiere corrugated packaging company in Western Canada. Our state-of-the-art manufacturing facility in Richmond BC works seamlessly with our sales offices and distribution centres in Kelowna, Calgary and Edmonton to provide outstanding products and services to over 900 customers throughout the region.

We hope you find our website informative and well organized to provide you with an overview of who we are and what we do.

Rob Kreizenbeck, Chief Executive Officer

Our journey

More than 100 years of supporting health

From our first yogurts in pharmacies, we have certainly come a long way in over 100 years. Our products, ranging from yogurts and plant-based products, to waters, and specialized nutrition products, are now part of everyday life in millions of households.

We're proud to be present in over 120 countries around the world, making healthy eating and drinking accessible to as many people as possible.

INNOVATIVE AUTOMATION SOLUTIONS
Your premier partner for packaging and automation solutions
DGT Solutions Inc. is a proud Canadian trusted industrial equipment manufacturer, recognized for delivering cutting-edge automation machinery, including robotic palletizers, case packers, labeling machines, box formers, liquid filling machines, capping machines, feeding systems, conveyor systems. Whether you need upgrades or complete automation solutions, count on us for top-notch expertise.

As an official system partner of KUKA Robotics, we provide turn-key solutions to our customers and a true "A-to-Z" response to our customer's automation needs. DGT Solutions Inc. continues to successfully integrate equipment with KUKA Robotic units in a variety of production operations.

Get a quote
OUR SPECIALTIES
Robotic Case Packer
Our automated robotic packing system is designed to efficiently and accurately grip and pack a wide variety of products into cases or boxes, ensuring a secure and organized arrangement.
Automatic Box Palletizer
Our automated palletizing system is designed to efficiently and accurately stack boxes or drums onto a standard wooden pallet, precise and stable arrangement.
Automatic Container Capper
Our automated capping system is designed to rapidly feed, orient, and apply caps or lids to bottles or containers of various shapes and sizes.
Automatic Filling Line
The line filling machine was designed to efficiently and accurately fill liquids of various viscosities, such as water, syrup, and motor oil, into containers of different shapes and sizes.
Automatic Labeling Machine
Our automated labeling system is designed to label products and packaging, including containers and bags, ensuring clear and consistent identification.
Automatic Cartoning Machine
Our automated carton handling system is designed to efficiently pick up carton blanks, fold them, and load them with products, ensuring streamlined packaging operations.
Pouch Packing Machine
Our automated bagging system is designed to carefully pre-open bags, load them with products, and then securely close and seal them, ensuring a reliable and airtight package.
Our recent projects



Automatic Box Palletizing System

The automatic palletizer machine is a sophisticated system designed for the efficient and precise palletizing of sealed boxes, organizing them according to predetermined patterns followed up with wrapping from stretch film, ensuring secure containment and stability during transportation and storage.

Learn more
Automatic Label Applicator Machine

The Automated System for Front and Back Label Application on Diverse Containers is an advanced solution tailored for precise labeling. It adeptly organizes containers with remarkable precision and speed, followed by the secure wrapping of stretch film to ensure stability during transportation and storage.

Learn more
Automatic Box Forming and Sealing

The Automated Box Forming and Sealing Machine is a cutting-edge solution engineered for swift and precise box assembly and sealing. It efficiently constructs boxes with remarkable accuracy and speed, followed by secure sealing to guarantee product integrity

Everyone knows that playing keno involves a bit of luck. While experts suggest that there is no way to predict the winning numbers accurately, it's fascinating to examine the most drawn keno numbers https://nz-casinoonline.com/blog/most-drawn-keno-numbers-at-nz-online-casinos/.
It turns out that certain numbers have consistently come up more frequently than others over the years.

It's always good to have a game plan while playing, so why not use this data to improve your strategy slightly? Whether you're a seasoned keno player or a newcomer, analyzing the most drawn keno numbers might be worth considering on your next visit to the casino.
And, if all else fails and no numbers seem to be working in your favor, maybe it's time to take a break and drink works, and give Lady Luck a chance to intervene.

W miarę jak świat powoli odchodzi od gier online na rzecz gier mobilnych, gry kasynowe zaczynają podążać za tym trendem. Wiele gier jest obecnie tworzonych z myślą o urządzeniach mobilnych, co oznacza, że są one projektowane na mniejszy ekran, a następnie dostosowywane do trybu online.
Jednak spośród tysięcy gier, które są dostępne w setkach kasyn online, większość z nich została zaprojektowana dla platformy online. Aby umożliwić masową migrację tych gier, stworzono platformę zwaną HTML 5.
Nie wdając się w szczegóły, HTML 5 jest platformą kodowania, która pozwala stronom internetowym, grom, kasyno online Paysafecard i teraz slotom na płynność pomiędzy urządzeniami online i mobilnymi. Oznacza to, że program może być opracowany na tej platformie i dostępny na wielu urządzeniach.
Wszystko to oznacza, że gracz slotów jest teraz w stanie grać w gry na iOS, Android, Windows mobile i każdej innej platformie mobilnej. Gry, w większości, zostały pięknie przeniesione w poprzek i mogą być renderowane, aby dopasować się do każdego rozmiaru ekranu lub rozdzielczości.
FANTA HALLOWEEN

VIEW PROJECT

Een van de belangrijkste doelen van regelgeving omtrent online gokken is het beschermen van spelers tegen de risico's van gokken. Bedrijven die een vergunning willen verkrijgen, moeten daarom maatregelen nemen om te voorkomen dat spelers te veel geld uitgeven en om problematisch gokgedrag te identificeren en te behandelen. Spelers moeten ook toegang hebben tot informatie over gokverslaving en hulpmiddelen om dit te voorkomen.
Er zijn verschillende soorten online gokspellen beschikbaar, waaronder videoslots, tafelspellen zoals blackjack en roulette, poker en sportweddenschappen. Elk spel heeft zijn eigen regels en strategieën, en het is belangrijk om deze te begrijpen voordat je begint met spelen. Veel goksites met iDeal bieden gratis versies van spellen aan, zodat je ze kunt uitproberen voordat je begint met echt geld spelen.

At Edgewell, motion is in our DNA. It’s in every product we make and every life we touch, and is the reason we chose a hummingbird as our emblem. We are always on the move to do better and be better; making personal care products that infuse joy into the everyday.

Never. Stop. Thriving.

Our well-loved and well-known family of brands feature products that bring joy to the everyday by helping you care for yourself, live life to the fullest, and express everything that makes you special and unique. We're proud to deliver a global portfolio of brands that provide confidence, protection, comfort, and quality when and where it matters most.

Our Brands 
Never. Stop. Caring.

We are on a sustainability journey, innovating products, transforming packaging, championing diversity, equity and inclusion, and doing our part to care for each other and our planet.

Our Mission 
Never. Stop. Smiling.

We are a people-first organization. From shareholders to consumers, we believe that everyone benefits when we nurture passion, encourage curiosity, inspire experimentation, and spread joy through our work.

Our Culture 
Never. Stop. Growing.

We find joy in cultivating a diverse, nurturing culture where good ideas thrive, and individuality is recognized. If you’re looking for a fulfilling career where you can make a meaningful impact, we’d love to have you join us.

Custom Thermoformed Plastic Packaging

Elmes Packaging specializes in custom thin gauge thermoforming. Our designs are made to your exact specifications using the highest quality materials.

Our Commitment

We pride ourselves on providing superior service and high-quality products to our customers. Since our founding in 1975, we have been committed to delivering exceptional packaging solutions from our facility in Mississauga, Ontario, serving clients across Canada, the U.S., and Europe.

Technology and Innovation

Our strength combines innovative design with state-of-the-art technology to create solutions to the most demanding thermoformed packaging challenges. Whether you require intricate, multi-cavity, nesting/stackable trays and clamshells or simple, single-cavity shipping platforms, we work with you through all phases of the product development cycle to design packaging to your exact specifications.

LEARN MORE
Thermoforming Experts

We are your thin-gauge thermoforming experts. The process involves heating a thin sheet of plastic until it becomes pliable, then shaping it over a mold to create precise, durable, and lightweight packaging solutions. The finished product is ideal for a wide range of packaging applications suitable for nearly every industry.

LEARN MORE
Customer Experience

Partnerships are at the center of everything we do. Our products are developed using the highest quality plastics and service is a priority. We respond to all inquiries by the next business day and the efficiency of our process allows us to deliver cost-effective packaging solutions significantly faster than our competitors.

Service de conception et design

Transformez vos idées en réalité avec notre service de design spécialisé dans l’éco-conception. Solutions d'Emballage Personnalisées et Efficaces

Mitchel Lincoln est le fabricant d’emballages en carton ondulé le plus productif du Québec—boîtes, présentoirs et feuilles. Nos installations de fabrication ultramodernes, couvrant un total de 1 000 000 pieds carrés, sont capables de relever vos projets les plus ambitieux—ainsi que les plus simples.

PILIERS STRATÉGIQUES
Expérience Client

Nous proposons des solutions personnalisées avec une équipe de service dévouée pour une communication transparente avec le client, de la livraison jusqu’au service après-vente.

Excellence Opérationnelle

Nous favorisons l’excellence opérationnelle en garantissant une performance de coût, des normes de production strictes et un respect accru de la qualité du produit.

Innovation

Nous investissons dans les plus récentes technologies et processus pour innover et trouver de nouvelles solutions pour nos produits. Nous effectuons des audits régulièrement de nos emballages dans le but d’améliorer l’efficacité et réduire les coûts.

Intégration verticale

Innovation continue dans le papier et le carton, avec quatre machines opérant à Toronto pour assurer un approvisionnement sécurisé et un contrôle direct de la chaîne d’approvisionnement.

Our mandate is to develop, manage and improve systems to recover used packaging and end-of-life products from consumers and ensure that they are properly recycled and not land-filled or incinerated.

Focused on Sustainable innovation & bringing the products and colours you use every day to life!

As a global leader in the production of print consumables for the print and packaging industries, Flint Group is dedicated to surpassing the needs of printers and converters worldwide.  Our teams focus on sustainable innovations and enhancing a circular economy in packaging.

Flint Group is committed to serving the needs of the global Flexible Packaging, Paper & Board, Narrow Web, Folding Carton, Publication and Offset printing industries – both conventional and digitally printed. Our teams diligently develop, manufacture and market a vast portfolio of printing consumables and equipment. We prioritise customer support through an unwavering commitment to developing innovative and sustainably focused products, ensuring exceptional service, and maintaining a secure supply chain.

Step into the Future of Printing Excellence with Flint Group!

Global Leadership, Local Excellence

Global Leadership, Local Excellence: Flint Group, a global leader in print consumables for the print and packaging industries, goes beyond meeting expectations—we exceed them. With a commitment to global excellence, we cater to the needs of printers and converters worldwide.

Diverse Industries, Tailored Solutions

Your industry, your needs. Flint Group is dedicated to serving the global Flexible Packaging, Paper & Board, Narrow Web, Folding Carton, and Publication industries. Whether you're into conventional or digital printing, our vast portfolio of consumables and equipment is meticulously developed to elevate your printing experience.

Innovation in Every Drop

Our teams work relentlessly, developing, manufacturing, and marketing cutting-edge printing consumables and equipment. At Flint Group, innovation is not just a buzzword; it's in our DNA. Expect high-performance ink and coating solutions that redefine the benchmarks of productivity and quality.

Customer Support Beyond Borders

Partnering with Flint Group means prioritising your success. Our commitment to exceptional customer support is unwavering. Backed by a global network of service teams and centres of excellence, we ensure you receive the assistance you need at every step.

Sustainability at the Heart

Sustainability is not just a goal; it's our Core Value. Flint Group is deeply committed to assisting customers in achieving their sustainability goals. We lead the printing industry in economic, environmental, and social sustainability, making a positive impact across all segments

Ethics in Every Decision

At Flint Group, business ethics is non-negotiable. Integrity and compliance are not just catchwords but embedded in our culture. Our staff adheres to a formal Code of Conduct, reflecting our commitment to ethical business practices.

Discover the future of printing with Flint Group. Unleash the power of innovation, sustainability, and ethics in every print. Join us on this journey at flintgrp.com, where excellence meets global leadership.

On every shelf. In every home. For all Canadians.

Food, Health & Consumer Products of Canada is the leading voice uniting companies, large and small, that provide access to the food, health, and consumer products Canadians rely on every day. 

As a leader in evidence-based, growth-oriented policy, we help our members support the well-being of all Canadians and the security of our food supply, while contributing to the expansion of Canada's economy and the sustainability of our healthcare system and the environment.

Upcoming Events

Your business success depends on your ability to stay on top of industry research and emerging trends. FHCP membership gives you access to world class-industry events, education sessions, benchmarking studies and more!

Browse our upcoming events below:

Why join?

In today's uncertain operating environment, the challenges facing your business are more complicated and fast-moving than ever before. You need critical insights, best practices, and access to experts who know how to drive change. That's where we come in.

Impact

Our members make up more than 75% of what is sold on store shelves. We have the size, scope, and credibility to be heard by both retailers and government.

Support

Access our team of leading experts who can assist with everything from retail and regulatory insights to supply chain efficiencies to government and retail advocacy.

Insight

Stay on top of policy development, industry research, and emerging trends through access to benchmarking, education sessions, industry events, and our preferred list of service providers.

Influence

From achieving a fair business environment, to overregulation that leads to higher costs, to environmental stewardship and labour concerns, we give you the power to help shape policies and practices.

About FHCP

Food, Health & Consumer Products of Canada (FHCP) is the voice of Canada’s leading food, health, & consumer product manufacturers. Our industry employs more people than any other manufacturing sector in Canada, across businesses of all sizes that manufacture and distribute the safe, high-quality products at the heart of healthy homes, healthy communities, and a healthy Canada.

OUR STORY

our planet isn’t single use

Takeout food contributes to millions of single-use containers thrown out every day. Recyclable and compostable packaging are part of the problem.

We believe packaging destined for the trash should be a thing of the past. Our simple reusable system keep containers in circulation instead of in landfills.

we make sustainability easy for your business

The environment is on more people's minds today than ever before. We'll set you up with everything you need to start offering sustainable reusable containers. Make a real impact and attract new eco-conscious customers.

Conveniently order our containers and schedule your delivery online with your business account.

track your impact

THE GLOBAL LEADER IN
Founded in 1947, FROMM has become a global leader in creating handheld tools designed to secure and protect transport loads worldwide.
STRAPPING
Since the early 1990s, FROMM has led the way with its innovative battery-powered hand tools for plastic straps. Users quickly favored these tools for their durable tensioning and locking heads, combined with the revolutionary strap insertion design. FROMM continues to set the standard for quality and reliability.
SHOP OUR TOOLS
AUTOMATION
FROMM Packaging Systems provides cutting-edge automatic solutions for various materials and products. Each piece of equipment is customized to meet your specific needs, fitting seamlessly into your existing or new facility. Contact FROMM to talk to an automation specialist and start your order today.
EXPLORE & GET STARTED
AIRPAD
The compact and portable AIRPAD® machines create protective and void-filling materials with just the push of a button, requiring no operator. AIRPAD® is made from rolls of flat film inflated with air. The formed pads are then coiled into a large, lightweight roll or transferred to a hopper system.

A specialist operational implementation consulting firm with a difference.
Contact Us

Fullstep Consulting Inc is a global supply chain and operations consulting firm trusted by many CEO and private equity firms to drive compelling economic returns for their companies. This is achieved by delivering accelerated, sustainable improvements in both EBITDA and cash across their procurement, logistics and operations to enable growth. Fullstep’s hands-on implementation experts work with executives and their teams to rapidly break through functional silos and transform the buy-make-move-fulfill supply chain to deliver the greatest value to customers and investors at the lowest cost to business. This approach is called Total Value Optimization (TVO).

Fullstep’s engagements are results-driven and deliver between 4:1-8:1 ROI. Confident in our work and our processes, we provide a unique 100% guarantee of engagement fees based on annualized savings.

A specialist operational implementation consulting firm with a difference


Fullstep delivers compelling economic returns to its clients by accelerating performance improvements in EBITDA, cash flow and growth through:
• Operations Excellence
• Strategic Procurement
• Logistics

Fullstep achieves this by implementing a uniquely integrated approach from analysis, leadership and organizational alignment through to implementation and sustainability. Fullstep’s goal for customers is to help them implement a synchronized buy-make-move-fulfill supply chain. This is optimized to anticipate customer demand patterns at the lowest business cost through Total Value Optimization.


Benefits to our approach

Find the Information You Need on a Company’s Headquarters
Find the Information You Need on a Company’s Headquarters

For years you’ve been spending hours looking for the best ways to contact a company headquarters. One website has a phone number – another has what looks like an email address. Then, once you have the little information you can find, you have no idea who is in charge so you’re just sending a blind message. These problems are not something the consumer should have to deal with, so we created Headquartersinfo.com.

We aim to give you all the information you need to contact a company’s headquarters in one place. No more searching from one website to the next in hopes of collecting a few details here and there. Simply search for the company using the search bar and you have every piece of information.

Want to find out the Starbucks number or details on a Starbucks franchise? Head on over to Starbucks Headquarters and you’ll find it.

Want to know the experiences of other people who’ve tried to contact Apple corporate? You can read through tons of comments about Apple HQ from visitors just like you.

We’ve got a team of dedicated writers and researchers spending hours digging through all the information found online. Phone numbers are tested and email addresses are checked and double-checked. You can rest assured you’re getting the latest, up-to-date information on how to contact a company’s headquarters.

Can’t find the company you’re looking for? Feel free to use our contact page to send the name and we’ll research it. We aim to provide the most comprehensive database of headquarters information online.

Tailored Packaging Solutions

Materials We Use

Combining strength with sustainability, these resilient materials enhance your product's production capabilities.

Wood

Wood-based materials, derived from responsibly managed forests, offer exceptional durability and versatility. Sourced from renewable forests, our wood pulp is biodegradable and contributes to the lifecycle of sustainability by reducing environmental impact. We prioritize ethical sourcing to ensure our materials support global sustainability goals.

Sugarcane Bagasse

Sugarcane bagasse, a byproduct of the sugarcane industry, is an eco-friendly, biodegradable, and compostable material. By repurposing this agricultural waste, we offer a sustainable alternative for molding packaging that reduces waste and supports circular economies. Bagasse is one of the most sustainable materials available, promoting a cleaner, greener planet.

Bamboo

Bamboo, a naturally renewable resource, is one of the fastest-growing plants on earth. It requires no fertilizers and regenerates from its own root system, reducing the need for replanting. By choosing bamboo-based pulp, we reduce our reliance on traditional wood and help conserve forests. This sustainable material is an ideal choice for environmentally-conscious production processes.

Still Using Outdated Packaging?

Innovative Eco Packaging Solutions - From Design To Manufacturing | Green Valley


With the rise of “plastic bans” and growing environmental concerns, eco-friendly packaging is becoming a must.

Molded pulp, made from a blend of paper pulp, cardboard, and sustainable fibers, offers a superior, environmentally responsible alternative. It’s not only durable and effective but also aligns with the increasing demand for sustainable business practices.

Why Choose Molded Pulp Packaging?
Eco Friendly

Made from plant fibers, molded pulp is biodegradable, moisture-resistant, and provides excellent shock absorption, making it an environmentally responsible choice.

Cost-Effective

Molded pulp packaging is lightweight and stackable, optimizing transportation efficiency, reducing shipping costs, and maximizing warehouse space.

Customization

With the ability to be molded into various shapes, molded pulp offers flexible solutions tailored to meet specific packaging needs.

High-Capacity Production

Our automated production process supports high-volume demand, ensuring consistency and reliability in large-scale orders.

Do You Know ？
It only takes around 60 Days for the Packaging to degrade into carbon dioxide, water, and organic fertilizer.

The process begins with the packaging absorbing moisture, softening its structure and making it vulnerable to microbial colonization. Microbes produce enzymes that break down cellulose into simpler sugars, which are metabolized into carbon dioxide, water, and biomass.

Simultaneously, environmental factors cause the physical breakdown of the packaging, ultimately leading to complete mineralization into basic inorganic molecules. The end products assimilate harmlessly into the environment.

Degradation rate varies with factors such as moisture, temperature, microbial diversity, pH, and oxygen levels.

Our Approach

Our Experts Are the Finest

The world’s understanding of what it means to recycle is changing. Our linear take-make-waste society is eyeing a more intentional and circular model; of which, Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR) has an important role to play.

 

Greenstreets is a group of environmental professionals who believe in this transition and who are well equipped to help Producers comply with the legislation making them accountable for what they are putting into the consumer recycling bin.

 

Compliance is a one-way street, let Greenstreets guide you down it.
