The Hitachi Continuous Inkjet Printers (CIJ) are known for their reliability, durability, and being the lowest cost of operating Product Coders. Used for product batch code, traceability code, barcode, or recall code Hitachi has you covered. With multiple ink options to choose from, including food approved and environmentally friendly inks, they are easy to use with extremely low maintenance needs.

LEARN MORE

The Foxjet Line of Inkjet Printers are known for their high resolution print allowing for barcode printing, high quality logo's, longest warranties in the industry, and low maintenance costs due to their self-cleaning printheads. Their labelling series are best known for lower costs of operation due to their all-electric applicator modules.

LEARN MORE

Today’s marking applications require a company with the product range and integration services necessary for successful implementation…  a company that becomes your partner in striving to meet your company’s unique requirements. Harlund is proud to partner with Matthews Marking Systems for this ability.

LEARN MORE

Control. Is. Everything! 100% non-proprietary servo motors and programmable drives married to the highest quality engineered stainless steel parts ensure precision application of your pressure sensitive labels. Every Nita SMART Labeling System is built with Trusync™ and Virtual Operator Assistant™ software that make changeovers seamless and keep your machine running!

LEARN MORE

Whether you're looking to package food, medical equipment or nutraceuticals, there is an Emplex Bag Sealer and/or Automatic Bagging solution to meet your requirements. If what you need is a shrink wrapped solution, Damark Shrinkwrap & Bundling systems deliver precise seals and accurate shrink wrapping for strong, attractive packages.

LEARN MORE

Any manufacturer or packager needs to put their product into a carton, tray, or case. They need look no further than ECONOCORP Inc. For over 50 years, ECONOCORP Inc. has been recognized as a worldwide leader in the cartoning equipment and case packing industry.

LEARN MORE

Orion Packaging Systems designs and manufactures automatic stretch wrappers and semi-automatic pallet wrapping machines. For more than 30 years, Orion has been in the business of protecting our customers’ products. Our goal is to provide the highest quality industrial stretch-wrapping systems in the industry using proven designs, durable materials and high quality components. With thousands of installations worldwide, Orion sets the industry standard for durability, efficiency, flexibility, reliability and performance.

LEARN MORE

Wexxar/Bel is the world leader in case forming and sealing machinery solutions. Since 1977, Wexxar has designed and manufactured leading edge case erecting, case sealing and tray forming machinery for corrugated container packaging. In 2005, Wexxar and Belcor joined forces to offer the combined Wexxar/BEL brand. The BEL and Wexxar names are already known in the marketplace, and together assemble more than 15 major industry innovations in end-of-line packaging solutions that deliver benefits and value to the customer.

LEARN MORE

EASYPRINT offers innovative thermal transfer printing solutions for all types of variable data – such as traceability and bar codes – onto flexible packaging material within a wide range of industries, including food, pharmaceuticals and labels. We provide a comprehensive range of high-speed thermal transfer printers for Intermittent and Continuous motion on vertical and horizontal packaging machinery, thermal forming machines and labellers. 

LEARN MORE

Evolabel develops, manufactures, and supplies innovative and intuitive label print and apply systems for automatic labeling in your production or warehousing facilities. By simplicity through technology, Evolabel printer applicators are designed for ease of install, operation, integration, maintenance, reliability, robust and safe.

LEARN MORE

Harlund Inkjet Coding Systems

In the industry for over 35 years, Harlund is recognized as Canada's inkjet coding systems and identification specialists for three reasons. We don't just sell equipment, we consult, and we service everything as well. We carry Foxjet printer, Hitachi inkjet printers and more.

In our specialty, we represent the cutting edge top players and offer the widest range of equipment in Canada. Our consulting service is backed by expertise in application, software design, and system installation - from complete turnkey operations to systems that integrate with other devices on an established production line, down to the most basic needs. Our service is unmatched. We have the longest warranties in the industry. Our expert technicians are factory trained. We service everything we sell through Canada-wide telephone and on-site technical service and support. You'll have a hard time finding the word "downtime" in the Harlund dictionary.

Call us and let us show you new ways to optimize the performance of your manufacturing line while cutting costs. It takes talent and expertise, and we've got it.

Who We Are and What You Get

Founded in 1917 in Denmark, Hartmann is the world’s leading manufacturer of moulded fibre egg packaging, the leading manufacturer of fruit packaging in South America, and a leading manufacturer of machinery for producing moulded fibre packaging. 

You can be sure of maximum product protection, packing runability and in-store saleability. In other words, we create extra value for our customers.

READ MORE
Egg Packaging

You can choose from a wide array of environmentally friendly egg packaging made from moulded fibre in an extensive range of pack sizes, colours and shapes.

READ MORE
Fresh Food Packaging

This new product concept is designed to cut down on the ​plastic used in fresh food packaging by giving producers an environmentally friendly alternative made from moulded fibre.

READ MORE
Egg Marketing

As a Hartmann customer, you can benefit from a huge choice of professional marketing services based on consumer insights, for example, packaging design that includes appealing graphics and messaging that drive sales.

READ MORE
Technology

As a packaging manufacturer, you can benefit from a state-of-the-art moulded fibre technology platform comprising complete production lines, moulds, tooling and spare parts, as well as comprehensive service and technology support.

READ MORE
	
Sustainability
Today’s newspaper. Tomorrow’s egg carton.
 Drawing upon our extensive expertise as a global leader in recyclable and biodegradable moulded fibre packaging made from recovered paper, we are firmly committed to further minimising our climate and environmental footprint. Hartmann’s extensive global network, which includes hundreds of companies, prioritises upholding our environmental, social, and governance responsibilities across the entire value chain.

EQUIPMENT
PACKAGING
SERVICE

For over 35 years, HSP has offered food packaging solutions with a service oriented mission, placing our customers at the forefront of our business. We’ve partnered with world class, leading edge manufacturers to offer the most innovative, sustainable, and competitive packaging solutions in the industry.

Our Pledge
Equipment.

HSP is the Canadian distributor of world class packaging lines – SEALPAC, ESPERA, PULSOTRONIC, and WITT.

We are proud to represent these innovative and lowest cost of ownership lines in Canada.

Packaging.

HSP offers a range of sustainable packaging solutions that meet today’s changing retail requirements.

Our aim is to ensure you get the most sustainable total food packaging solutions that not only protect your food products while extending shelf-life and reducing food waste, but that can also be recycled.

Service.

Heat Sealing Packaging is one of the leading service oriented companies in our industry. We offer you a professional team of qualified specialists, technicians, project managers for issues concerning all aspects of your packaging and packaging equipment.

HOW WILL YOUR BRAND SHAPE UP IN 2025?
ARE YOU STUCK? TRY OUR CREATIVE THINKING WORKSHOP

DO YOU NEED HELP TO CREATE A SUSTAINABLE BRAND?

WHAT  We specialise in taking deep dives with brands to solve their challenges, one by one, using creative thinking. Joining the dots to create the bigger picture. It starts with a conversation. It could end with a brand identity; a new product launch; or a service that creates value in society; or a deeper understanding of who you are and what you stand for. Whatever the challenge, we’ll be on the journey with you and find the way forward together to achieve your goals.

We get under the skin of exciting organisations looking to do good and help them to overcome their challenges in creative ways, with our Creative Critical Thinking Workshops, unlock the business challenge with a creative solution.

HOW We’re agile (because we work with a network of brilliant independent creatives); we’re energetic (because we only work on projects that get us excited); and we’re committed (because if we’re working with you, we believe in your goals and creating sustainable value in the world).

That’s all well and good, but the missing link in many consultancies doesn’t crop up in a lot of business processes: empathy. Because strong solutions don’t come from us swooping down and telling you what to do – they come from deep conversation, understanding and true collaboration.

BRAND STRATEGY

Why do people need strategy in their lives?

READ MORE

BRAND REFRESH

How do you know if you brand or organisation needs a refresh? What are you goals and are you able to leverage your brand to achieve them. Goal posts move, with day to day challenges, sustainability targets and the creating a better world and the demands and needs of your people internally and externally. Refreshing a brand is complex and ‘a brand’ isnt just a logo! By having a conversation about what you want to achieve and why in a business context session will always tease out what is needed and also what the brief needs to be. There is a lot of pressure for people to know what needs changing and most briefs come from looking at where you need to get to and forming a project plan. With analysis, data, research fed into the upfront thinking, we work to form briefs maybe for us maybe for others whose skill set is needed. So to be clear a brand refresh is not always a new logo, it could be a better consumer journey, better signposting and brand awareness, or a new brand identity (which is a new logo)!

READ MORE

BRAND IDENTITY

What makes a good brand identity?

You can analyse identities and have research things until an inch of their life. A brand identity needs to have meaning and is if you think as a brand, as I do like a person. Everyone is unique, has a personality, decides how to project themselves, has behaviours unique to them, sounds differently. A brand identity is all those things, its the total sum of several elements that sets you apart and tells a story that engages certain people but not others. That’s fine we can’t all be friends with everyone nor would we have enough time to show up. Humanising a brand, an organisation, a non profit, a charity to appeal to other human beings is what we are good at. But like people everyone has a different vibe, different tribes they feel connected to and its getting to the heart of that, in order to really resonate with all your audiences.

READ MORE

BRAND ACTIVATION

How do you live engage others with the brand?

How do you bring ideas to life that are on brand, on mission and ensure you align with your purpose can often be harder than you think. Once your brand is developed, you as a business then have to live your brand. Having a strategic creative in the room that can interpret the brand beforehand and bring new ideas and thoughts to the party can often unlock or allow others in your own organisation to be brave and bold, empowering them to release their creative thoughts in a safe space.

Brand activation will always begin with who the audience in with that you have no idea what will resonate.

READ MORE

CREATIVE SPRINTS TO SOLVE BUSINESS CHALLENGES

How do you unlock a challenge using creativity?

How do you enable teams to think differently than their day to day thought processes. I design and create workshops, with my collaborators around individual business challenges. They can be virtual (we started in Covid and work globally) or in the same venue, choosing a creative space or bring the creativity to you. I draw on lots of agile methods and tested fun exercises to unlock everyone’s creative thoughts. But a sprint session is all well and good if you don’t outline a success criteria and scope out actions afterwards! Any creative sprint will be preloaded and involve a business context session (2 hr sprint) to understand what we need to unlock, who our stakeholders are and what we need to achieve. Using this way of working you can sprint ideas with you and your team.

From Owners and founders to marketing you can look at NPD pipeline ideation, all manner of brand challenges from Brand purpose, Brand activation, Brand vision and values, NPD pipeline ideation, to Brand activation. For HR people key challenges – recruitment and retention, reward and recognition. Any challenge can also benefit from a creative in the room to bring a different perspective.

READ MORE

WEBSITE DEVELOPMENT

As part of the digital journey we collaborate and bring in a specialist developer that will add value to the build of the project. Every project is very different so in the scoping we would look at the digital build requirements and what we can help with, or if you have some internal resource work with your team. Its as flexible as you need it to be.

READ MORE

EDUCATION – LECTURING, MENTORING & TALKS

How do we pay our knowledge forward?

As a key part of my own journey being inspired by industry professionals, I aim to use some of my time to help fellow creatives, children in education, universities to enrich or bring a new perspective into the room. Please contact me if there’s an opportunity to help in an education, or workplace setting to add value. In the past 2 years I have had guest speaker roles at Strathcylde Business School, Leeds Arts Uni (mentoring on a creative brief), mentored female creatives on ‘Kerning the Gap’ and created a vision workshop with Year 1 children to help with their values and career paths.

Calcium Carbonate Concentrates for the Plastics Industry

Heritage Plastics develops and manufactures a unique class of calcium carbonate concentrates for a wide variety of plastic resins and applications. Our concentrates are designed to improve the performance and productivity, and more importantly, to help offset any rising resin costs. Our calcium carbonate concentrates offer proven advantages for minimizing the overall carbon footprint of the finished product versus a "resin only" system. Our expertise is focused on highly filled mineral based concentrates using our unique Minapol™ Additive Technology.

Heritage Plastics calcium carbonate concentrates (masterbatch) are globally known for boosting the performance of blown film, blow molding, blow molded pipe, thermoforming polypropylene and polystyrene, extrusion coating, and injection molding with the use of HM10®, PolyMax™, Hical™, and PolyCal™.

British Columbia Landscape & Nursery Association

BCLNA promotes the global recognition of British Columbia as a leader in landscape horticulture. We provide an effective organization for meeting the needs of nursery growers, landscape professionals and garden centres, while:

Progressively engaging relevant issues to the benefit of the industry.
Actively promoting high standards of horticulture practices within the Province of British Columbia.
Provisioning skilled services to the public by members of the Association
Educating the relevance of horticulture in fostering the healthy stewardship and beautification of urban and rural environments

We are committed to the furtherance of the interests of members of the Association and to continue our work to attain the above principles.

Your success is our business

Employees, customers and suppliers alike all notice the same thing: it’s different at Hood Packaging. We are more relational than transactional. We are exceptionally reliable and extremely dependable. Work here and you will have a job for life in a thriving environment. Do business with us and enjoy national pricing with local service. Plus, you always get to talk with a real person. Always.

Not a job, a career

Imagine going to work with a smile on your face, getting treated like family, and being handsomely rewarded for proudly helping others. If that sounds like your kind of job, then we are your kind of company. Because at Hood Packaging, we also mold long, rewarding careers.

See available opportunities >
We have you covered

We’re also particularly good at listening to our customers and suppliers. When they asked for more than just products, we developed technical advisers to help their lines run better and faster. With our 22 plant locations and flexible production capabilities, we have North America covered. Think of us as a multiple supplier, yet all under one roof. Whenever you need a better package, we have you covered.

OUR PASSION FOR THE ENVIRONMENT RUNS DEEP.
WE’RE MORE THAN JUST A BOTTLED WATER COMPANY.
WE’RE RECYCLERS. ENVIRONMENTAL PROBLEM SOLVERS. COMMITTED TO RECYCLING 100% OF OUR PLASTIC, AGAIN AND AGAIN.

In 1995, our decision to start up a Canadian family-run company with a focus on sustainability just came naturally. Since then, Ice River has been dedicated to producing the highest quality, environmentally responsible bottled water out there.

Ice River Sustainable Solutions is known for our forward-thinking innovation in eco-friendly design. By shifting our focus to the plastic bottles that contained our natural spring water, we came up with new ways to recycle 100% of the bottle – right down to the cap. Even when we were told it couldn’t be done. Our green initiatives and our ambition grew from there.

WE SAW GREAT POTENTIAL IN PLASTIC.

We’re the first North American beverage company to build our own recycling facility, which is how we recycle the PET collected in the Blue Box and give that plastic new purpose. Collaborating with other companies, we produce eco-friendly packaging and products made from 100% recycled PET (polyethylene terephthalate) plastic, that are 100% recyclable. It just takes a little innovation and a lot of determination to find more sustainable solutions.

WE’VE KEPT OVER 425 MILLION POUNDS OF PLASTIC OUT OF NORTH AMERICA’S LANDFILLS SINCE 2009.

It’s worth every effort. Protecting the environment is at the heart of every business decision we make. If we all put in the work, we’ll all be able to enjoy this big, beautiful blue planet for many more generations to come.

Discover Our Innovations
PROUD TO BE ONE OF CANADA’S GREENEST EMPLOYERS
Ice River Sustainable Solutions has been named as one of Canada’s Greenest employers for 2023. This coveted award recognizes companies that have ‘green’ ingrained in their DNA, with a commitment to the environment backed up by exceptional sustainability programs and initiatives.

Awarded by Canada’s Top 100 Employers Project

The environmental impact of our recycling efforts are the numbers we use to measure our success.

See How We’re Committed to Change
WE’RE THE LARGEST PRIVATE LABEL BOTTLED WATER PRODUCER IN CANADA.

For over 25 years, Ice River has been producing private label bottled water for large retailers in Canada – you’ve probably had our water without even realizing it. From major grocery stores to merchandise and food chains, many iconic Canadian brands are proud to put their logo on a 100% recycled plastic bottle.

OUR FAMILY OF COMPANIES GET GREENER AS WE GROW.

Ice River Sustainable Solutions sees every environmental challenge as an opportunity. Sometimes a company reaches out to us, other times we approach them looking for more sustainable solutions. What matters is that we share the same ingenuity and commitment to increase our conservation efforts. And by keeping business local, we reduce our carbon footprint.

ABOUT ICE RIVER SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS
Ice River Sustainable Solutions is a Canadian family-owned company committed to bottling natural spring water, with a focus on sustainability and recycling PET plastic. We work with other businesses to find creative ways to reuse and recycle plastic bottles, producing environmentally friendly packaging and products made from 100% recycled plastic.

About IFS

IFS develops globally recognised product quality and safety standards and development programs with the expertise of retailers, manufacturers, certification bodies and other experts. With our help, companies increase the trustworthiness of their products and brands through a practised product and food safety culture.

learn more

2002
Foundation of IFS
> 40
Employees worldwide
2000+
Retail Accounts
> 30000
Certificates & LoCs
Quality Assurance and Integrity Program

The IFS Integrity Program ensures that our standards are properly implemented.

This is guaranteed by:

Integrity on-site checks,
Integrity witness audits,
and CB office audits.

In case of complaints, it is possible to reach IFS IP via the complaint-form or e-mail.

learn more

Accreditation & Recognition

With the accreditation of the certification bodies working with us and the IFS Standards, we ensure that our work is based on uniform international norms and thus on objectively verifiable quality standards. For us, accreditation means security and trust in our products.

learn more

Sustainability / ESG

Making processes, structures, and business models more sustainable is a constant challenge for many companies. To help especially small and medium-sized companies integrate environmental, social, and governance (ESG) principles, IFS offers the ESG Check. With this tool, we support you on your way to a greener and more socially responsible future.

learn more »

Product integrity / PIA

Ensure product integrity with IFS. We help you better understand and control risks relating to product integrity and food fraud. With our IFS PIA Assessment, you show your customer that you deliver products to specifications and manage your integrity risks properly.

learn more

Connecting people, knowledge and ideas

Informa is home to dozens of different brands and businesses. What we all share is a focus on connecting people, connecting knowledge and connecting ideas.

It’s how we help our customers succeed in their roles and businesses, and how we make a positive impact on the markets and communities we work in.

Introduction to Informa

Watch for a snapshot of Informa

Investing in Informa

Informa offers exposure to the growing, global knowledge and information economy.

We have leading specialist brands and businesses, scale positions in Academic and B2B Markets and strong financial characteristics.

Life at Informa

We champion our colleagues, all across the world. 

When it comes to life at Informa, no two days are the same and we celebrate the diversity of our teams and people.

But wherever and whoever you are, we give you the freedom to bring ideas to life, work that makes a real difference to our customers and markets, and the chance to be part of an international and inclusive community of great people. 

Join us for opportunities to build a varied career, in a company that's building for the future.

ITALIC is a visual communications company providing expert services and production for retail, entertainment and event industries since 2003.

WE ARE DIGITAL PRINT EXPERTS

We provide innovative, meaningful, purposeful communication solutions that help our clients deliver on their business needs.

Our partnerships thrive because we make a point of understanding each client's unique needs and collaborating to find the best solutions.

WE ARE INDUSTRY LEADERS

We’ve invested heavily in acquiring the best technology available and bringing it to the Canadian market. When challenged with seemingly impossible tasks, we discover new capabilities and techniques that we can apply in the future.

Through our adaptive approach and expertise, we achieve our clients’ visions with few limits. Our team loves to say yes.

WE CREATE EXPERIENCES

As brands recognize the greater impact when digital content and print campaigns work together, designers are turning to printers to brainstorm and collaborate about the best way to create experiences.

WE POWER BRANDS

Connect with Italic and we will automate your business.

Everyday our workflows are receiving and pushing projects directly to press, no human hands required.

DISCOVER YOUR OPPORTUNITIES

Jokey - your global partner for packaging solutions

High-quality plastic packaging for food and non-food.

Jokey is a leading international manufacturer of rigid plastic packaging with lids. We produce plastic buckets, plastic tubs, plastic boxes and plastic trays by injection moulding. We offer food and non-food producers sophisticated, industry-specific packaging solutions.

Packaging from Jokey stands for top quality, hygiene, user-friendliness and innovation. Our standard range includes round, rectangular, square and oval plastic packaging from 120 ml to 35 l. Our buckets, tubs and trays are 100% recyclable in the recycling cycle. From the resulting secondary raw materials we produce environmentally friendly packaging for non-food products.

For 55 years, the name Jokey has stood for outstanding know-how in plastic injection moulding and customer-oriented service. With 2,300 employees, we produce in 16 plants in 13 countries and supply customers in around 80 countries. Our own tool manufacturing company, a division for technical plastic parts, and our high-quality bathroom furniture range round off our plastics competence.

Packaging the Future of Healthcare

We enable advances in healthcare with packaging that protects product integrity and helps consumers make informed decisions. 

Over a century of partnership across healthcare sectors allows us to continue to develop progressive platforms that respond to evolving pharmaceutical packaging services needs and help our customers put consumer wellness first.

Products & Services

From folding cartons, labels, blistering, pouching, convenience vial filling and secondary packaging to a wide range of specialized medication adherence and dispensing products for pharmacies and long-term care, we offer integrated packaging options with a reputation for outstanding quality and customer support.

SEE OUR PRODUCTS & SERVICES
Who We Are

Jones has been a long-time, trusted partner for some of the most recognized global pharmaceutical and healthcare brands, and the largest pharmacy groups, independent pharmacies, hospitals and long-term care facilities across the world.

From packaging that protects and informs to new platforms that improve consumer outcomes — we are invested in promoting healthcare.

LEARN MORE ABOUT US
Innovation Lab

At Jones, we nurture curiosity with a purpose and innovation based on insight. This has led us to a history of “market-firsts” — and an ongoing commitment to staying ahead of the curve.

From our CpaX™ line of connected, intelligent packaging to the latest in product development, best practice and market leadership, our Innovation Lab showcases how we’re advancing packaging.

KacePack cannabis packaging, made in North America
In January, we wrote about combatting supply chain delays for cannabis brands. ABOUT US
Kinsbrae Packaging is a full-service outlet for sustainable, custom, and premium packaging that helps builds brands. We serve customers in the food, wine, spirits, beer, retail, and nutraceutical sectors, providing a full range of packaging solutions and in-house services. We engineer custom solutions while supporting our clients with inventory management and providing delivery on a just-in-time basis. We are always on the lookout for the next eco-friendly and innovative packaging solutions for our customers.

Label Design is a fully SQF Food Certified manufacturing operation located in Guelph.

We specialize in pressure sensitive labels, selling primarily in Ontario and throughout Canada.​

By continuously renewing our technology and maintaining focus on quality and customer needs,

Label Design has grown steadily since its foundation in 1990. ​

LEARN MORE
Household & Apparel​

Designed to fit a wide variety of shapes, contours and surfaces and to ensure your brand will be seen and chosen first.

Learn More
Industrial ​

Your label must adhere to multiple surfaces under challenging conditions. We have the expertise to ensure outstanding performance.

Learn More
Food

High end, food certified labels that will make your product stand out on the shelf with excellent consumer appeal.

Learn More
Automotive ​

Automotive labels are essential for the accurate tracking of components. Proper adhesion to tough surfaces must be ensured.

Learn More
Health & Personal Care​

Packaging is everything in this category. Our state of the art printing technology will give your brand the high end shelf appeal it needs.

Learn More
Specialty

Promotional and extended content labels provide consumers the information they need, and help to increase sales.

Learn More
Capabilities

Speed to market and customer satisfaction can only be achieved by acquiring state of the art systems, outstanding printing technology and by hiring the best people.

At Label Design, we have friendly and knowledgeable staff that will handle all your needs at every stage, from cost estimates to artwork management to delivery updates. We can print up to 10 colors using UV curable or water based inks on our state of the art printing presses.​ Our quality control includes photo vision systems both on press and on the converting equipment that check every label to ensure a perfect product, every time.

Sustainability

As the packaging industry is under increased pressure to develop green technologies and products, Label Design has put in place a strategy to help our customers achieve their sustainability goals.

Label Design is closely integrated with its suppliers to secure access to materials that meet today’s evolving sustainability goals. ​We have the in-house expertise and will work with you to review your packaging portfolio and applications, provide practical advice and actionable items on how to make your packaging greener. ​Moreover, Label Design will help you with your liner waste recycling needs.​

Get In Touch

Do you have a question about Label Design Ltd., our products, or services?  We would welcome an opportunity to be of assistance on your next project and invite you to call us toll-free at 1-888-488-9930, or use the contact form to get in touch.

For your accessibility needs, please contact Manuel Garces, General Manager at 519-763-3563 or manuel@labeldesign.ca.

COVID-19 Protocol
Label Design Ltd. is considered an “Essential Service” and will remain open during Red Zone; Grey Zone or State of Emergency designations but with limited access to visitors.  Our safety procedures are in accordance with current Public Health and Ministry regulations.  Please call ahead to book an appointment and/or to request a copy of our COVID-19 Safety Plan.

Previous
Nanographic Printing®

Placing Landa NanoInk® droplets onto a heated blanket before they are transferred to the substrate brings remarkable characteristics to the print process.

Agile Production

Combining digital flexibility with an industrial build, Landa Nanographic Printing® Presses meet the growing need of print providers to optimize yield for all types of jobs.

Prints on Anything

Landa Nanographic Printing® Presses deliver stunning results on any paper, coated or uncoated.

Best-in-Class Color and Quality

Breathtaking images printed by Landa Nanographic Printing® Presses are the best in the industry, offering the richest colors.

B1/41” Format

Nanographic Printing® Presses fit seamlessly into any offset environment. The B1/41” format allows production on standard industry stock.

Committed to the Environment

At the core of our commitment is Landa NanoInk®. A water-based ink compatible with deinking, the images it achieves on recycled paper are unmatched.

Next
Landa Nanographic Printing® Presses

Designed for mainstream digital printing, the Landa Nanographic Printing® Presses are the only field proven B1 format digital presses in the market today. Powered by Landa’s patented Nanography® technology, the presses combine the performance of offset with the versatility of digital printing. Landa presses enable a new and unmatched standard of high-quality production, agility, speed, sustainability and cost-efficiency.

Landa S11

The Landa S11 Nanographic Printing® Press is the only field proven B1 single-sided sheetfed digital press. Designed for the production of mainstream folding cartons, the S11 delivers unmatched offset speed, quality and stability.

Landa S11P

The Landa S11P Nanographic Printing® Press is the only field proven B1 double, or single, sided sheetfed digital press. Designed for mainstream commercial production, the S11P delivers unmatched offset speed, quality and versatility.

Contact & Imprint

The law firm of Joachim Quoden is specialised in producer responsibility legislation with a focus on the European Packaging and Packaging Waste Directive and its implementation in the 27 Member States, the members of the European Economic Area and the Accession Countries.

Moreover, expertise on the packaging legislation in Canada, US, Japan and other non-European countries can be given as well as advice on the implementation of the WEEE and the Battery Directive in the different European Member States.

Besides legal advice, monitoring of respective developments within the European Commission and the European Parliament can be provided, as well as â€“ if required  - contacts to the relevant stakeholders in Brussels.

Also, special questions around topics like â€œmandatory deposit for one-way beverage containersâ€, â€œbiodegradable packagingâ€ and â€œcarbon footprintâ€ can be answered.

As very often the challenges of companies regarding the practical implementation of producer responsibility are not limited to legal advice, co-operations have been agreed upon with other environmental and economical consultants all over Europe and beyond to offer the best solution for every question possible.

Especially for matters in the Czech Republic, a co-operation agreement with the law firm of Dr Michaela Kozlova in Prague is in place so that a comprehensive support can be provided to foreign companies conducting business in Czech Republic.

Helping Canadians Live Life Well®

We provide the building blocks to help Canadians create the best life, and future that they can.

What we do
The latest

A passion for customers sits at the heart of our organization, and supports our commitment to help Canadians live their life well.

Thank you for helping to Feed More Families®

We wanted to take a moment to recognize the amazing work of our stores and operators throughout our Loblaw Feed More Families® Holiday Food Drive last month. Together, we raised more than $2.8 million for local food banks across the country.

Healthcare’s big 3 for 2024

Our top priority is helping Canadians live life well® and to achieve that, we aim to provide them with as many opportunities as possible to do so. Whether it’s expanding pharmacy services to treat and prescribe for minor ailments, or the ability to conveniently refill a prescription through an app on their mobile device, we invest in truly making a difference to positively impact their day-to-day.

DEI pillar leads share progress and plans for 2025

For over a decade, Loblaw has been becoming more inclusive because it’s the right thing to do for people, and for business. At the centre are our four DEI pillars: Able, Embrace Your Roots, Proud, and Go Further Women. Each pillar has leaders who work with hundreds of colleagues across the company on events and projects to support our DEI initiatives. We caught up with our pillar leads to understand the progress made, and their vision for the year ahead.

The top ESG stories of 2024

As a purpose-led business, ESG is routed in everything we do and is also something we talk about a lot – like a lot, a lot.

About Luminite
 
 
What we do here & how we can help you.

Providing the highest quality products and services for the flexographic industry since 1926, Luminite Products Corporation offers direct laser-engraved elastomer sleeves, cylinders, & plates for the flexographic printing industry.

Luminite offers the original continuous print solution, with our In-the-round (ITR) technology allowing for a continuous, seamless print. Our elastomer sleeve materials, as opposed to photopolymer sleeves, have greater resilience to combat the rigorous stresses of the printing process.

Support Every Step of the Way
In House Surface Tension Testing

Luminite will help you manage surface tension in your process to maximize print quality. We can provide measurements of critical surface tension variables, as well as expert assistance in optimizing them.

Color Management / Press Characterization

Luminite provides full support for your color-critical work. We’ll help you to accurately predict results before going to press and can provide soft proofs for either spot or process work.

Assistance for Conversion to Sleeves

Luminite offers a wide range of tooling support options. We can provide anything from basic specs or engineering diagrams to finished sets of mandrels to meet your production needs.

Functional coatings
for recyclable packaging
Our Affiliations

The APR Design Guide for Plastic Recyclability sets guidelines and recognizes packaging innovations which help recycling. Based on a high-volume commercial scale recyclability test for shrink sleeves we demonstrated that our magnetizable coatings technology significantly improves sorting out of problematic labels in operations commonly used for recycling PET containers

The use of Magmark coatings allow brands to address Target 1 of the U.S. Plastics Pact, the elimination of problematic and unnecessary packaging, by transforming PETG shrink sleeves from problematic, to preferred for recycling

How2Recycle, a project of the non-profit GreenBlue, is a standardized labeling system intended to communicate disposal instructions to the public. Magmark SS coatings, together with a PETG shrink sleeve and an otherwise recyclable PET bottle and cap, allow the bottle to be considered “Optimally Recyclable”, without the removal of the sleeves

We’re on a journey to
Raise the Good in Food
What are you looking for?
We’re a carbon neutral food company on a purposeful journey to Raise the Good in Food through better nutrition, safer food and workplaces, more humane animal care, and sustainability efforts that protect our planet.

We care about our communities and have committed to reducing food insecurity in Canada.

Join us on the journey. Let’s build a better future, together.

We are carbon neutral

We know that the food we make leaves an environmental footprint and we are committed to taking meaningful action to protect the planet. Our vision is to be the most sustainable protein company on Earth because we need to help build a better food industry. 

Our sustainability commitments are central to our business and they guide us each step of the way – in the food we make, how we care for our animals, our people, our communities, and the planet.
 
We have a plan and we’re sticking to it.

Read more

Maple Leaf Foods’

Strategic Split

Creating two independent public companies each with a sharper focus to execute its own growth strategy and pursue its uncompromising commitment to best-in-class sustainability practices.

The strategic compass for the organization

Our Blueprint

The Blueprint outlines our Company’s five core strategies in our pursuit of delivering shared value for our stakeholders. With a passion to create shared value, we:

– Lead the Way 
– Build Loved Brands 
– Broaden our Impact 
– Operate with Excellence 
– Develop Extraordinary Talent

Fraudulent website alert

We have been made aware of a fraudulent website using the Maple Leaf name, logo and content to impersonate Maple Leaf Foods (“MLF”) in order to trick visitors into supplying sensitive personal or financial information. Internet users are cautioned to engage only with MLF’s official websites including www.mapleleaffoods.com and www.mapleleaf.ca, and pages linked through these sites. The official MLF corporate website has many resources that will direct you to the product, service or assistance you need.

Eastern Canada's
Ecofriendly corrugated packaging manufacturer

Maritime Paper Products LP is the leading manufacturer of Corrugated Packaging in Atlantic Canada. It has three manufacturing facilities located on the east coast of Canada, with convenient access to a major shipping port for easy export worldwide.

Maritime Paper produces high-quality corrugated packaging products, including the standard brown shipping carton, 7 color flexographic printing, retail displays, specialty folding, die cuts, wax cascaded cartons, and bulk bins. 

Everything is riding on the choices you’ve made, the partner you’ve selected, and the boxes protecting your product.

 

We have the experience and technology to be that partner. 




Maritime Paper Products Limited Partnership prides itself on being one of the industry’s most technically advanced companies.

​ADVANCED TECHNOLOGIES & LEADING EDGE FACILITIES

At Maritime Paper, our facilities are equipped to produce custom packaging with your company’s imaging and logo. We’re known for our technical capabilities (equipment) as we are for the quality of our custom packaging solutions and our graphic services.

LEARN MORE
SUSTAINABLE PACKAGING MANUFACTURING

Maritime Paper provides custom packaging solutions to a wide range of industries, including:

 

​  Breweries

​  Fish and seafood

​  Fruit and vegetable

​  Meat and poultry

 

To ensure product quality and ecological sustainability, Maritime Paper conducts audits as per the EcoAdvance® Audit Program and favours EnviroShield®’s line of 100% recyclable materials. We also provide wax packaging solutions.

 

Providing the right combination of modern manufacturing, new technologies and experienced service means our customers reap the benefits of top quality packaging products, every time.

Elevating emotional connections between brands and consumers

Labels play a powerful role in the consumer buying process. Put our packaging passion and expertise to work for you at MCC – where every product is labeled with care.

The ultimate labeling experience
Our mission at MCC is to produce the world’s best labels by supporting customers every step of the way. From concept – to commercialization – and beyond.

Our collaborative approach enables true alignment and efficiency throughout the entire production cycle. Cross-functional teams like Research & Development through to Technical Field Support are committed to producing the optimal labels to achieve your product and packaging goals.

Our Sustainability Credo
We are a proud leader in the industry when it comes to the development of sustainable label solutions.

In fact, over 70% of projects in our pipeline are driven by improved recyclability. Our organizational emphasis on sustainability is multi-faceted, with three focus areas: our operations, our solutions, and our customers. By signing global pacts, we are demonstrating our commitment to minimizing environmental impact.

LEARN MORE
All About Innovation
Listening to customers’ needs, monitoring market trends, and leaning into our expertise are three ingredients to innovative success.

We have systems and processes in place that allow us to bring continuous improvement and disruptive innovations to market, including labels with improved recyclability, labels that level up premiumization, and unique combinations of all sorts of criteria you’re looking for in the optimal packaging solutions.

LEARN MORE

‘More Black Designers’ is the New Black

The 2024 McDonald’s Change of Fashion Program is focused on driving change when it comes to Black representation in fashion. The industry frequently pulls inspiration from Black culture, but doesn’t always embrace Black creatives. After all, only 7.3% of American fashion designers are Black.*

 

So, we’re pairing five, rising Black designers with five fashion insiders for career-changing mentorships. The program will also provide access and resources, and give their brands a chance to shine.

 

*Per Zippia.com as of 2021.

Follow on Instagram @wearegolden
“McD’s Best Burgers Ever.” - Hamburglar

You’re gonna love the hotter, juicier, tastier upgrades we’ve made to burgers like our Cheeseburger and Double Cheeseburger.* From patties grilled with onions and perfectly melted cheese to new soft, pillowy buns—these are our best burgers yet. Ask the Hamburglar, he can’t keep his hands off of ‘em. Robble, robble.

 

Get one today in the app for pickup or McDelivery®.^

 

*Comparison of McDonald’s classic burgers to prior burgers.
^At participating McDonald’s. McDelivery prices may be higher than at restaurants. Delivery/other fees may apply.

Order in the App
New: Faster Faves, Only in the App

We now prep when you’re on the way if you choose Curbside, Front Counter—or dine in for Table Service. Just order ahead in the app to save time. Because waiting in line for faves? Not our thing either.*

 

*At participating McDonald’s.

Order Ahead in the App
Deals for Days


Get exclusive deals on your McDonald’s favorites in the app with contactless Mobile Order & Pay* and convenient Drive Thru or Curbside pickup.

 

*Mobile Order & Pay at participating McDonald’s.

Témoins
Bienvenue sur
Les préférences en matière de témoins (cookies), c’est votre choix! Nous et nos partenaires numériques utilisons des témoins ou des technologies similaires (« témoins ») sur ce Site. Certains sont strictement nécessaires au fonctionnement du Site, et d’autres ne sont pas strictement nécessaires et permettent de proposer une expérience, des contenus et des offres personnalisés. Ils nous aident également à comprendre comment le Site est utilisé et à améliorer sa performance, tout en proposant des publicités plus pertinentes selon vos intérêts.

Les témoins strictement nécessaires sont toujours activés. Vous pouvez activer ou refuser les témoins non strictement nécessaires en cliquant sur « Tout Accepter » ou « Tout Refuser ». Vous pouvez aussi paramétrer vos préférences en cliquant sur « Paramétrer ». Vous pouvez modifier vos choix en tout temps.

Pour en savoir plus sur les témoins et vos droits, consultez lapolitique de confidentialité.

Metro Vancouver is a federation of 21 municipalities, one electoral area, and one treaty First Nation that collaboratively plans for and delivers regional-scale services
Featured Initiatives


Reducing Sewer Overflows

​Cracked pipes on your property can let in rain that can overload our sewer system. Learn how to reduce the risk.​


Food Scraps Aren’t Garbage

​​By putting food scraps in the green bin, Metro Vancouverites are reducing the amount of garbage sent to landfill, helping prevent greenhouse gas emissions, and creating compost. Click to learn more.​


Updated Regional Projections

​​This region is expecting an increase of nearly one and a half million new residents, over 600,000 new homes, and 650,000 new jobs by the year 2050, according to Metro Vancouver’s latest projections. Find out more.​​


New Regional Park in Metro Vancouver

South Langley Regional Park will preserve and share a special environment with the public.​


Metro 2050 Performance Monitoring Dashboard

​Metro Vancouver has launched a vital tool for monitoring progress towards the five key goals​​​​​ in Metro 2050. See how we’re doing and view the latest regional data.​


North Shore Wastewater Treatment Plant Program

​Metro Vancouver is building a new wastewater treatment plant for the North Shore, to protect our public health and the environment.​


Learn, Explore, Have Fun

Connect with friends and family in nature at a Regional Parks program or event. Browse fall/winter activities.


Comment on Proposed Amendments to the Regional Growth Strategy

​​Learn more about and have your say on proposed amendments to Metro 2050, the Regional Growth Strategy.​​

Welcome to Miraclon's flexo printing solutions

Brands and consumers are demanding more from their packaging print than ever before. Through our innovative FLEXCEL NX Technology and applications expertise, we’ve been helping our customers respond to that demand for over 10 years while meeting their efficiency, sustainability and quality goals.

Together we are enabling the transformation to modern flexo.

About Miraclon 
Products and Technology

Our Integrated FLEXCEL Solutions are fully optimized and consist of a single core plate type, an imaging system, software, and specialized print application expertise. Flaws and variability have been engineered out, yielding the most predictable and consistent on-press performance, color and quality.

Products and technology 
Sustainability

When looking at how we can impact sustainability, we take a holistic approach that focuses on understanding the big, material impacts and challenging how we can make a difference across the packaging value chain. Our products and technologies enable more sustainable printing.

Learn about our holistic approach 
Your Partner for Modern Flexo

Flexo is evolving from its ‘traditional’ capabilities, practices and processes to an era of ‘modern’ flexo that is consistent, highly capable, efficient and more sustainable. Miraclon, together with our customers and partners, is leading this transformation through our differentiated FLEXCEL NX Technology and applications expertise.

Discover Modern Flexo

Multiply Your Value.

MULTIVAC is a family business from the Allgäu region in southern Germany that operates at an international level. With integrated packaging and processing solutions, we offer customers from the food, consumer & industrial goods and medical & pharmaceutical sectors exactly what they need: Individual added value - across the entire logistics chain.

With over 80 subsidiaries, we are on site for our customers in 165 countries and support individual customers of all sizes just as directly and personally as multinational companies.

What would you like to package or process?
Food
Innovative packaging solutions for fresh meat, sausage and deli meats, alternative proteins, poultry, cheese and snacks – reliably processed and packaged with MULTIVAC.
Learn more
Medical products
MULTIVAC packaging solutions for sterile medical products ensure reliable, reproducible and traceable processes.
Learn more
Pharmaceutical products
MULTIVAC offers solutions for the flexible packaging of syringes, vials, ampoules, auto injectors, active stents, pens and many other pharmaceutical products.
Learn more
Industrial and consumer products
MULTIVAC packaging for industrial and consumer products is produced on sustainable, customized packaging machines and lines.
Learn more
Current top topics

Majority stake in Italianpack S.p.A.

MULTIVAC Group acquires a majority stake in Italianpack S.p.A.

The MULTIVAC Group has acquired a majority holding of 80 percent in Italianpack S.p.A., a manufacturer of packaging machines. Italianpack will be integrated into the MULTIVAC organization as a new business unit, which will enable the portfolio to be expanded to include traysealers in the lower and medium price segments, as well as other peripheral equipment. The aim is to strengthen the market position and better meet customer requirements.

 

 

Learn more

Revolutionizing meat processing!

State-of-the-art vacuum and skin packaging machines put a Montreal-based meat processor on the fast track to growth in the retail space.

Bis 15.02. für ein zulassungsfreies Studium bewerben

Die Hochschule München: eine der vielfältigsten Hochschulen für angewandte Wissenschaften in Deutschland

Ein breit gefächertes Studienangebot, ein Fokus auf angewandte Forschung und Praxisorientierung sowie Exzellenz als Gründerhochschule – damit verspricht die HM ihren Studierenden herausragende Chancen in Wissenschaft und Wirtschaft.

Studieren an der HM
Studiengänge mit Zukunft

Viele gute Gründe sprechen für ein Studium an der größten bayerischen Hochschule für angewandte Wissenschaften. Zum Beispiel rund 90 Studiengänge in den Ausbildungsrichtungen Technik, Wirtschaft, Soziales und Design. Mit ihnen bietet die Hochschule München eine erstklassige praxisbezogene und zukunftsorientierte Ausbildung.

Erstellung eines Wissenschaftlichen Exposés (Wahlpflichtmodul)

Das Exposé ist ein zentrales Element für die erfolgreiche Gestaltung des eigenen wissenschaftlichen (Promotions-) Projektes. Es sollte daher sorgfältig durchdacht und ausgearbeitet werden. Als Zusammenfassung des Forschungsvorhabens dient es weit mehr als nur der Erfüllung von Bewerbungsanforderungen.

Lehre
Wissenschaftlich, praxisnah, zukunftsorientiert

Wer heute an der HM studiert, wird schon morgen die Zukunft mitgestalten. Um auf diese Verantwortung vorzubereiten, verknüpft ein Studium an der HM eine fachlich hervorragende Hochschulbildung mit gesellschaftlichen Megatrends wie Nachhaltigkeit oder Internationalisierung. Möglich wird das durch praxiserfahrene Lehrende und einen lebendigen Campus, der persönlichen Austausch und digitale Innovationen miteinander verbindet.

Innovative Lehre

Qualität in der Lehre

Weiterbildungszentrum

Kompetenzprofile

Hightech Agenda Bayern

Forschung
Angewandt, innovativ, interdisziplinär

Die anwendungsorientierten Forschungsprojekte der HM setzen Impulse in Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft. Sie greifen aktuelle Herausforderungen auf und leisten einen innovativen Beitrag zu einer nachhaltig gestalteten Zukunft. Forschungs- und Entwicklungsprojekte auf hohem Niveau, unter anderem in fünf Forschungsinstituten, bestimmen die gut vernetzte Forschungslandschaft der HM.

Forschung an der HM

Energiewende

Transformation

Maschinelles Lernen

Forschungsinstitute

Promotion & Postdocs

Transfer
Praxisorientiert, kooperativ, entrepreneurial

München ist eine der führenden Wirtschaftsmetropolen Europas. In diesem Innovationsökosystem will die HM eine bedeutende Rolle einnehmen. Hierzu arbeiten wir eng und bedarfsorientiert mit unseren Partnerinnen und Partnern aus Wirtschaft, Gesellschaft, Politik und Wissenschaft an technologischen sowie gesellschaftlichen Fragestellungen zusammen. Als eine der führenden Hochschulen in Entrepreneurship verstehen wir dieses als transformative und Zukunftsfähigkeit sichernde Kraft.

OUR PROMISE
Food you can feel good about

At Nature Fresh Farms, we don’t just provide premium produce, we grow for a kinder future. We’re passionate about creating a better way forward for people and the planet through long-term sustainability and creative innovation, which is why we only use the most advanced greenhouse technology and efficient resourcing methods. We make it our mission to help others eat well and live their best lives … discover how we are planting the seeds for a brighter tomorrow.

Our Story

Health and wellness is our business

“At Nature Fresh Farms, it’s not just our responsibility to feed folks across North America with high-quality produce, it’s a privilege. Knowing that we’re stocking shelves with nutritious, fresh products is what gets us out of bed in the morning. Ensuring our products are nutritious, fresh, and grown with the highest safety standards keeps us moving forward. Because when we do our jobs better, people eat better and live healthier lives. It’s that simple, and it doesn’t get much better than that.”

Matt Quiring,
SVP Sales and Marketing

GROWING MORE WITH LESS
The benefits of
greenhouse growing
Discover Our Process
sustainable
food system

Greenhouse growing is redefining the way we think about farming. That’s because its foundation is a sustainable food system, which allows us to cultivate produce in a controlled and protected environment, making the most of our resources, cutting waste, and consistently delivering top-quality fruits and veggies. The result? Healthier outcomes for both you and the planet.

vertical
growing

Things always look up when greenhouse clean produce grows in that direction. Vertical greenhouse growing allows us to fit the equivalent of up to 15 acres of field-grown farmland into one acre of space. What’s it all lead up to? Greater efficiency, long-term sustainability, and true optimism for the future.

reduced
food miles

We make sure our farms are close to your grocery stores. When produce arrives faster, it’s bigger on nutrient-density, freshness and flavor. And smaller on our carbon footprint.

Discover NaviLens
The cutting edge technology for the visually impaired

Free download available:

​ ​
Empowering the visually impaired

Many visually impaired people have difficulty using traditional signage and therefore find it a challenge to be autonomous in unfamiliar environments.

Visually impaired users can use NaviLens codes, as they do not need to know precisely where they are placed.

Just scan with your mobile camera and get the necessary information contextualized.

Test this code with NaviLens App ▲

12x times farther than QR and barcode
Very fast
1/30 seconds to read
Wide angle reading up to 160º
Reading in all light conditions
Accuracy & Orientation
Unfocused
More inclusive cities

NaviLens helps make cities smarter and more inclusive. The capabilities of this code allow users to interact more easily and accessible with their environment in places such as subway stations, bus stops and museums or public buildings.

Do you want to know more about the possibilities it offers? Read this code with NaviLens Go! App

Discover the interface

100% user friendly interface for the visually impaired

Features
THE FASTEST

Reading markers with NaviLens is almost instantaneous.

LONG DISTANCE

Capable of reading the labels from long distances, depending on the size of the marker.

NO FOCUS

No need for focusing, which is essential for people with visual impairments.

MOVEMENT

Navilens algorithm detects the tags when the user is walking or in motion while the cell phone is pointed up.

PRECISE DISTANCE AND ORIENTATION

Navilens accurately detects the distance between the user and the tags. In addition, NaviLens provides the relative angle of the user with respect to the tag.

MULTIPLE READING

It detects multiple tags simultaneously, efficiently communicating them to the user

Testimonies
The most important, the opinion of the users
Coca-Cola® Christmas Pack
Coca-Cola UK becomes first beverage brand to pilot Navilens technology for visually impaired

Coca-Cola has rolled out NaviLens codes across 24x330ml and 30x330ml packs of its Christmas can multipacks, which can be scanned from distances of up to four metres to help blind and partially sighted consumers.

Brands already trusting NaviLens
Where is NaviLens
Metropolitan Transportation Authority
(New York Metro)
 NaviLens code marker at Jay St platform

In this station, over 100 NaviLens codes:
(1) Help the visually-impaired users to be more independent in unknown spaces,

(2) Guide all users indoors through virtual arrows in a very innovative Augmented Reality (AR) experience, without GPS or Bluetooth,

(3) Offer real-time train arrivals information scanning any NaviLens code,

(4) And all of these features in 34 languages, breaking language barriers of all subway users.

It's a revolution for indoor navigation where it's not possible to use GPS or other computer-vision methods.

 NaviLens code at Jay St MetroTech Station entrance.
 Audible information for visually-impaired users scanning the code far away.
 Augmented reality technology based on proprietary computer vision technology.
 A 10 inches NaviLens code can be read up to 60 feet away in 0.03 seconds, covering 160° degrees.

Two Apps Available to interact with this new technology:

The NaviLens App helps visually-impaired users, who can scan the codes without needing to know exactly where they are, offering the same information as the signage very accurately.

The NaviLens GO App provides in-station navigation, trip planning information, train arrivals and service status information to help sighted users navigate the station and the system.

You can check by yourself how well the technology works, pointing your phone towards the photos of this email using any NaviLens Apps.



Real-time information scanning the code far away.
 The code can be printed in any material, like vinyl and can be placed very high. The code can be scanned by a mobile phone up 80° degrees (Vertically & horizontally).
 The code is very easy to implement at any space: As easy as emplacement the code over current signage.

MORE INFO
Ariel’s new cardboard ECOCLIC®
Ariel’s new cardboard ECOCLIC® box is more inclusive for all thanks to new design, NaviLens technology and innovative tactile markers

For the first time ever, Ariel presents its new and revolutionary cardboard ECOCLIC® box that ‘clicks’ all the boxes. The new cardboard packaging is FSC certified[1] and has been designed to be inclusive and intuitive for all adults to open thanks to ground-breaking tech and is certified for child safety. Ariel’s partnership with NaviLens ensures that consumers with sight loss are empowered to access important product information quickly and easily scanning a new colorful accessible code with the NaviLens App. The new packaging is also more ergonomic to use and has a clever and reassuringly loud ‘one click’ which lets you know the packaging is closed after use and ensures little ones stay safe.

[1] Made from well-managed FSC® certified forests and from other recycled materials

Next Generation Nano-structured Material Derived from Ocean Waste

Our Technology

The culmination of a decade of research and development, the combination of both high performance and environmental sustainability, speaks to us to find out how Neptune is creating a brand-new class of innovative nano-structured material from organic ocean waste via proprietary technology.

“Advanced, Renewable, High Performance”
Applications
BIODEGRADABLES

Neptune can supercharge the biodegradable materials industry by enabling higher performance and even better sustainability.

AEROSPACE

Neptune is disrupting the aerospace, automotive industries by enabling the creation of stronger, tougher, lighter, and greener composites.

BIOMEDICAL

Neptune is disrupting the biomedical industry by making next generation implantable medical devices better, safer, and more biocompatible.

ADHESIVE/COATING

Neptune is disrupting the adhesives and coatings industry by enabling the creation of high-performance adhesives/coatings with programmable rheology.

3D PRINTING

Neptune is disrupting the additive manufacturing/3D printing industry by enabling the creation of high strength nano-structured 3D printing material.

PACKAGING

Neptune is disrupting the packaging industry by enabling next generation packaging plastics to be higher performance, smarter, recyclable and biodegradable.

Discover Packaging Excellence with Norlands Box Co. Inc.

Your Trusted Partner for Premium Packaging Solutions.
At Norlands Box Co. Inc., we’re passionate about crafting packaging solutions that elevate your brand.
We understand that every business is unique, which is why we offer customizable packaging solutions tailored to your specific requirements. Whether you need retail packaging that stands out or shipping boxes that withstand the rigors of transit, we’ve got you covered.
From functional designs in customised sizes to high quality graphic printing, our packaging solutions are designed to captivate and inspire.

Why Choose Us
The Norlands Advantage

Our in-house state-of-the-art corrugator ensures high quality sheets in the shortest turnaround time. From raw materials to the final product, we have quality checks at each step.

Exceptional Service

From concept to delivery, we prioritize customer satisfaction above all else. Our standard delivery time for all orders is 8 business days. We can also make rush orders within 3 business days of order confirmation.

Unrivaled Quality

With a relentless commitment to quality, we deliver packaging solutions that stand out for their durability and functionality along with their aesthetics Utilizing state-of-the-art flexo and digital printing technology, we ensure vibrant colors and crisp graphics that elevate the visual appeal of your packaging.

Our Process

At Norlands Box Co. Inc., we have a 5-step mantra that we take pride in. It is a meticulous process, ensuring that every box we produce meets the highest standards of quality and craftsmanship. From initial concept to final delivery, our process is designed to exceed your expectations at every step:

01
Consultation

We begin by understanding your packaging needs and objectives. Whether you’re looking for a custom solution or selecting from our range of standard products, our team works closely with you to determine the perfect packaging solution for your business.

02
Design

Our team of experienced designers brings your vision to life with innovative and eye-catching packaging designs. Using the latest tools and technologies, we create packaging that not only enhances your brand image but also provides practical functionality.

03
Production

With state-of-the-art facilities and advanced manufacturing processes, we ensure precision and consistency in every box we produce. Our skilled craftsmen bring the designs to reality, using only the finest materials and techniques.

04
Quality Assurance

Before any box leaves our facility, it undergoes rigorous quality checks to ensure it meets our stringent standards. From structural integrity to print quality, we leave no stone unturned in ensuring that your packaging arrives in perfect condition.

05
Delivery

Whether you need a small batch of boxes or a large-scale production run, we handle every order with the same level of care and attention. With efficient logistics and reliable shipping partners, we ensure that your packaging arrives on time, every time.

Experience the Norlands Box Co. Inc. difference today!
Contact us

At Norlands, waste is not an afterthought. Our commitment to sustainability involves a holistic approach, ensuring that waste is minimized, and materials are reused or recycled whenever possible.

Reducing, Reusing, Recycling

We prioritize the use of eco-friendly materials, ensuring that our packaging solutions have a minimal impact on the environment.

Eco-Friendly Materials

Our commitment extends beyond lip service. Norlands contributes to the eco-friendly initiative by actively participating in the recycling of over 25 million tons of corrugated materials annually, aligning with our commitment to sustainable practices.

Recyclable and Renewable Practices

We source corrugated materials from SFI® Certified suppliers in North America, giving preference to local mills with high post-consumer recycled content (up to 65%).

Local Sourcing for Global Impact

We continuously explore innovative packaging alternatives and sustainable practices, seeking to push the boundaries of what's possible in the realm of green packaging.

Innovative Solutions for a Greener Future

Passionate about Labels. Driven by Quality.

Located just north of Toronto in Barrie, Ontario, Canada. Northern Label was built on the foundation of being a high quality manufacturer of pressure sensitive labels in the Prime Label market. Since then, we have grown into a full service boutique label and flexible packaging print converter. When it comes to labels, there isn’t much we can’t do. We have the technology, knowledge, and expertise to take your brand to the next level.

We define quality as conformability to our customers’ written standards and specifications while adhering to a constant commitment to continuously improve our operations. To guarantee you the best quality, we rely both on setting high standards while harmonizing the processes.

News and Stories
Innovation. Transformation. Glass Packaging.

Glass is a material unlike any other, capable of creating stunning, memorable experiences, and it’s the most sustainable packaging material on earth. At O-I, we have a history of transforming how the world stores food and beverages – of making glass more accessible to more customers and consumers. We reimagine how glass is made and sold by innovating production techniques, pioneering recycling and sustainable technology, and unleashing the iconic, brand-building potential of this packaging that is the kindest material for the planet and its people.

Read Our Story
OUR VISION
Shaping the Future Through Glass

We create iconic, healthy glass packaging so synonymous with brands, you recognize those brands by their packaging alone, even without a label. We innovate packaging design to enable customers to meet their own ambitions, from connecting with consumers on an emotional level to creating a more sustainable future.

Learn Our Vision
Innovation at O-I
OUR STORY
Driven Through Innovation

Innovation and transformation are in our DNA. O-I Glass was founded more than a century ago by a man whose glass bottle making machine was called the most significant invention in glass in 2000 years. Founder Michael J. Owens’ motto was “It can be done.” And we’re doing it. We’re reimaging what glass can do, making it the world’s most versatile, charismatic and sustainable packaging material.

OUR MISSION
Our Sustainability Vision

Glass is the ideal packaging material to support a low-waste, circular economy. But sustainability isn’t just about what we make – it’s also about how we make it. Sustainability is woven into everything we do, from transforming our glass-making technology and processes to our customer approach to how we engage our employees and support our communities.

Learn Our Mission
1
2
3
Power of
Glass Packaging

Glass is pure, sustainable, and the kindest packaging material for the health of people and the planet. Glass has an element of magic to it. It is beautiful and iconic. It can turn into shapes. It plays with the senses. Glass is 100% recyclable and infinitely recyclable. It does not increase ocean pollution. Glass is virtually inert, which means it doesn’t interact with the foods and beverages it holds.

We love glass and we aspire to create a healthier, more sustainable, and more exciting world through glass packaging.

Discover Benefits of Glass
Guided by Our Values

At O-I, we deeply care about our people and our culture. Guided by our values and behaviors, we’re constantly seeking to transform how we support and engage employees and the communities in which we work and live.

See Our Careers

Our Vision

P-Duplex is a Toronto-based startup with a mission to be the first choice for sustainable packaging solutions in Canada.

Our innovative packaging solutions are designed to extend food freshness, whether on the shelf or the go. While never cutting back on quality or safety, we place the highest value on protecting people and our planet through sustainable practices which views “waste” as a resource to manufacture hygienic and food safe  materials.

Manufacturer & Supplier for the Food Industry
About us

Packall Packaging Inc. is a major supplier of flexible packaging to the food industry, with a specialty in meat, cheese, and seafood.

The company always insisted on acquiring quality leading-edge equipment that our employees quickly mastered. When we could not find the quality we insisted on, we built our own or modified it to our specifications. 

Packall is a full-line converter in that we manufacture films from resins. We also print, laminate, slit, and make pouches, all at our facility in Brampton. Packall is a registered ISO and SQF Level 3 company with certifications with FDA, KOSHER, GFTC, and OPALTONE Print System (Please see our certification page). These organizations continuously inspect our operations, and they certify that Packall is in compliance with their requirements for registration. You can be assured that the product it supplies is of the highest quality.

What We Do

PakItGreen specializes in a diverse range of environmentally conscious barrier and functional coating solutions tailored for the trillion-dollar printing and packaging industry. Consumer Packaged Goods (CPGs) and packaging converters can leverage our coating solutions to create sustainable packaging structures that are compostable, biodegradable, re-pulpable, recyclable, and free from plastic and PFAS.

Learn More About PakItGreen
Learn More About PakItGreen
Our Products

Our products are not only food-safe and non-fluorinated but are also cost-effective. Our versatile coatings offer resistance to oil, grease, moisture, and water and provides heat sealing properties. By applying these coatings to paper, we facilitate the elimination of single-use plastics and plastic-coated paper.

Learn More About Our Products
Learn More About Our Products
Our Goals

At PakItGreen, our success is built on unity and innovation, driving us towards a greener and more sustainable future together.

At PakItGreen,we’re dedicated to pioneering technological advancements and continuously enhancing our coatings to offer you the finest solutions available.
Our focus lies in delivering high-performance, innovative, and cost-effective solutions to a diverse range of industries, including consumer packaged goods (CPG) brands, converters, paper mills, and the food-service sector. Our goal is to help you achieve your sustainability objectives.
Understanding the unique needs of each industry, we tailor our offerings to match your specific applications and requirements. This commitment to customization ensures a seamless integration of our solutions into your processes, guaranteeing optimal results.
We thrive on collaboration. By partnering with stakeholders such as brand owners, converters, paper mills, and OEMs, we create a synergistic environment that keeps us at the forefront of technological advancements.

Providing food packaging across North America.
PEI Bag Co. is a Canadian supplier of bags, equipment, and supplies for food production facilities.
;
We service agriculture, aquaculture, and dry goods customers, supplying potato bags, produce bags, and dry goods bags, specifically leno mesh, multi-wall paper, FIBC, poly, flour and sugar bags. Our closing material options include Kwik Loks, threads and staples.
Our food packaging bags are available in a variety of styles, formats and size ranges, and for a number of applications including potatoes, carrots, turnips, sugar, flour, mussels and lobster.

As a full-service packaging company, we partner with industry leaders to ensure your food packaging requirements are met from the initial concept, artwork, printing plates, through to final manufacturing.

Our sales team is ready to serve your food packaging needs. Contact us today for information and pricing.

Plastic Film Supplier & Distributor

As a plastic film supplier and distributor since 1978, we have offered a stock line of plastic films for ‘just in time’ deliveries for multiple industries throughout North America.  In addition to our stock line of plastic films and sheets, PFC has strongly focused on the importance of individual companies that need specialized film for their manufacturing needs. Our multiple warehouses and relationships with our manufacturers have given us the capability to develop plastics all over the world and work to the needs of what our clients expect for their long-term success. Plastic Film Corporation is your one-stop shop for all your plastic film needs. Contact us to learn more!

REQUEST A QUOTE

CONTACT A TECHNICAL ADVISOR TODAY 
LEARN MORE ABOUT THE PLASTIC FILM CORP. 
EXPLORE
PLASTIC FILMS

PFC currently inventories one of the largest lines of PVC film, TPU film and HDPE sheet for industrial applications and bookbinding/POP industry. Along with our stock line of materials, our main strength with custom products and warehousing programs have set us above the rest in capabilities and experience.

LEARN MORE 
EXPLORE
BINDING MATERIALS

The bookbinding, stationery, and Point of Purchase business' are where the initial development of PFC began over 40 years ago. We patented our own finish on our film to help accommodate the manufacturers with multiple uses and less inventory, and have developed new films and products directly with our clients and maintained a quality film to meet all of today’s demanding regulations. PVC film and roll stoc, along with High Density Polypropylene (HDPE) sheet stock is available and ready for ‘next day’ delivery. PFC is constantly watching the marketplace and listening to our clients.

LEARN MORE 
EXPLORE
POOL LINERS

PFC has been a supplier of quality swimming pool liner film for over a decade. Under our strict quality specifications and award-winning design personnel, we have ranked amongst the highest selling patterns in overall pool liners. Every year, we are building new designs, and keeping up with the current trends and expansive preferences of the end consumer.

LEARN MORE 
Last Chance & Inventory Closeout

Ever looking for a deal or need to fulfill a small odd job?  We have an extensive line of discontinued items and overstocked custom widths and color.  We can answer any of your questions on these films, please look over the list and inquire with any of our internal sales force.

VIEW CLOSEOUT DEALS

WE ARE HERE TO HELP.

PFC takes pride in our knowledgeable staff and direct relationship with all of our manufacturers and engineers. Plastic Film Corporation can meet your needed requirements, whatever the type of plastic substrate. If we cannot manufacture it or immediately help you with our stock supply, we can assist you in sourcing it. Contact us today to learn more.

Promoting excellence in the creation, design, production, manufacturing and marketing of plastics products in New Zealand


Plastics New Zealand is the Industry Association for the New Zealand plastics industry. We support a wide range of companies in their quest to grow and succeed in the global marketplace. Plastics New Zealand provides tangible benefits to its Members helping them to operate a more profitable business. Our Members have access to exclusive information, training and educational opportunities that help them to operate smarter, cleaner and more efficiently. We also provide a collective voice for the Industry when dealing with Government, training, funding and research organisations. We invite you to experience the benefits that Plastics New Zealand can offer your company. Find out more...
